campaign.story:
Deluge, a Fountain Pen by Genesis - At the crossroads of technology and traditional handcraft
The Deluges Series
The Myths: 
Ancient Deluge mythology first appeared in the Eridu Genesis around 3000 BC in Mesopotamia. Ziusudra, a man well known for his humility and obedience. Ziusudra did as Sumer God commanded him and built a huge boat, in which he successfully rode out the flood. Then similar stories were then appeared in Epic Atrahasis (1500 BC), Epic of Gilgamesh, Deucalion in Greek folk mythology, Noah in Genesis, and so on.
The Deluges Stories
The Design: 
Deluge is the first series fountain pen released by our team, Genesis Pen. They tributes to the cultural heroes in the Deluge mythology by using the unique interior barrel design. The transparent barrel refracts the unique internal ink chamber. It assembled with a stack of rectangular blocks representing the Tablet of Eridu Genesis. Each layer of block rotates 11 degrees symbolizes the Deluge story in the Tablet XI of Epic of Gilgamesh. The whole structure consists of 50 layers of blocks and assembles as a helical structure that emulates the DNA 3D structure, the fundamental molecule of life. The ink chamber capacity is approximately 3 ml, which is larger than most ink cartridges, converters, and piston fillers. The Deluge initially comes with three styles named Ziusudra, Atrahasis, and Deucalion, after the historical heroes in the Deluge stories. Furthermore, we will release Noah, when the Stretch Goal is reached.
Close-up of the metal rings
The ink channel
Ziusudra with ink
Ziusudra with ink
Models:
Deluge - Ziusudra
Ziusudra
Ziusudra with the cap on
Ziusudra comes with the unique glass-like resin with golden rings. The hand-painted golden helix symbol and the sliver/gold two-tone nib make Ziusudra unique. 
 Deluge - Atrahasis
Atrahasis
Atrahasis, a fully transparent demonstrator comes with silver color German-made stain steel nib.
Deluge - Deucalion  
Deucalion
Deucalion, with unique triple black design together with a black ruthenium plated steel nib, makes it one-of-a-kind fountain pen in the market. 
The Making of: 
To construct such a complicated ink chamber structure inside the narrow pen barrel will not be successful without the use of edge-cutting technology, the Stereolithography (SLA) 3D Resin Printing. This technology uses light to solidify liquid photocrosslinking resins into a rigid solid resin. This technology opens up a new horizon in fountain pen design. 
Material: Fountain pen users have a high requirement and expectation towards fountain pen's materials and their durability. We have been searching for resins that give satisfaction texture and at the same time, compatible to SLA 3D printing. After a lot of trial and error, we finally identified the ideal material by using a self-formulated photo-crosslinking resin that is ideal for the fountain pen. After constructed by state-of-the-art 3D printing technology, the material will be solidified and remains strong, transparent, and unique. The material is resistant to water, methanol, ethanol, propanol, acetone, and most other organic solvents. Stable up to 200˚C heating. The Deluge series uses the hollow eye-dropper type of ink filling system. To facilitate pen washing, we paid a lot of effort in formulating the resin that can make the pen washing and writing be enjoyable. The rings on the pen are costed-bronze, which is shinny and rust resisting. 
Handcrafting: SLA 3D printing together with the self-formulated resin only took us halfway in reaching our goal. After printing, the material is rough and non-transparent that does not look like a pen that people will love. In order to solve this problem, we recruited a specialist to our team who has good pen polishing skills. We spent a lot of time researching the best polishing process for this new type of material. Finally, we came up with a series of processes to turn the printed "object" into a unique fountain pen that is transparent and rigid, yet feels smooth and warm like ebonite. 
Before and after hand-polishing
Pen washing has been a lot of people's concern, therefore we are adding a pen washing video to show the ease of cleaning. With our self-formulated resin, we ensure the ink will not be trapped in the ink chamber. 
PLAY

Specifications:
Length: 142.6 mm caped. 112 mm without the cap. (Cap cannot be posted)
Diameter: 14.5 mm
Weight: 25.5g 
System: Eye-dropper ink chamber (~3 ml)
Material: Self-formulated photocrosslinking Resin
Colors: Glass-like (Ziusudra); Transparent (Atrahasis); Triple Black (Deucalion); Transparent Red (Noah, Stretch goal item)
Nibs: Extra fine, fine, medium, board, and stub German-made JOWO #6 steel nib will be available/Fine, medium, and board German-madeJOWO #6 14k gold nib 
Customisation: We do provide engraving services to our backers. 1-2 alphabets of European languages or 1 Traditional/Simplified Chinese, Japanese, and Korean character can be engraved on the top of the pen with hand painted gold color.
Engraved and gold-painted Chinese character "Dragon" at the top of the pen.
Packaging: Each Deluge fountain pen will be protected by an aluminum case. All the pens will be shipped in a paper box or thick envelope to ensure zero damage to the pen during the shipment.
All the pens will be packed in aluminum cases.
Stretch Goals:
HKD$150,000 (USD~$19,200) - Unlock new style - Noah at HKD$799 (USD~%103). 
HKD$200,000 (USD~$25,680) - Everyone who pledges will reward a leather pen bag.
HKD$300,000 (USD~$38,000) - Unlock unique Deluge pen stand at the price of HKD$100. (USD~$13)
Noah
Sneak Peek of Deluge Pen Stand
Timeline:
Early 2016 - Designing a fountain pen with unique ink channels.
End of 2016 - the First prototype of Deluge was made.
2017 - Searching for materials, prototyping and modifying the design.
Jan 2018 - Researching on surface finishing process and nibs ordering
Aug 2018 - Starting Kickstarter campaign.
Oct 2018 - Production Starts
April 2019 - Shipping out the early bird rewards
May 2019 - Shipping out the rest of the orders

updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
Last week, our lathe was broken down, replacement need one month to come. So we immediately replace another one and now we are doubling our effort to complete the task. For the material, we already got another supplying source. So the material should be sufficient to complete the orders. We will keep shipping out the demonstrator next week.
Thank you Have a wonderful weekend The Genesis Pen Team
Thank you for waiting! We are going to ship out the Atrahesis (Demonstrator version) in the coming weeks. Enjoy!

Dear Backers,
We are happy to tell you that we are shipping out the second batch of pens who ordered the Collector Sets. Thank you for your waiting and we will continue ship out the rest in the near future.
Many thanks The Genesis Pen Team.

updates.update_userinfo: Another batch of pens are going to ship
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
It is our exciting moment to tell you that we are finally shipping the first box of products, the Genesis - Deucalion! Backers who ordered the Deucalion will receive the tracking number in the coming days. If anyone has problem receiving the tracking numbers and shipping address please let us know through email: genesispenco@gmail.com.
For those who orders 3 pens collector set, we are sorry that your order will not be shipped in this batch, but they will be in the next batch, we promise.
Good day backers! We have finally completed the making and engraving the bronze rings. It was really hard but satisfying work. Please stay tuned for the next update.

Dear Backers, 
Happy new year! We are sorry that we did not update for the pass few months. We are producing the parts we needs and at the same time, discarding failed print, trimming and extensive hand polishing to make sure it is in good quality. We are also spending half of our time in metal workshop handling the metal rings that made from raw bronze rods. Please stay tuned for the next update. For more information and updates, please visit our official website www.genesispens.com. Thank you very much.

campaign.story:
The Utility Knife Blade is an extremely useful tool, especially in the hand of a maker. Its uses are almost endless, yet few people use it. Why?
Because there is no holder designed to fit the needs of us makers.
So we decided to make one.
The Maker Knife is a tool made to be carried every day, everywhere you go. It is compact, lightweight, super quick and easy to open. No more looking for a blade. No more interruptions while you’re working on a project. The Maker Knife is always there, ready to swiftly help you work more efficiently.
- Jimmy Diresta
          Oh yeah did we mention it’s freaking magic? The locking mechanism is extremely easy to use. There are no buttons to push. No weird finger movements to do. You can just flick it open with your thumb or a finger.
The blade holder automatically locks securely into place when it reaches the top and by witchcraft unlocks when you pull it back down. It really does feel like magic!
"WTF!?? How does it work?" - That guy in a red shirt that tried to figure out the mechanism for 2 minutes while pushing it back and forth.
No springs, just magic.
          More magic! Pretty cool right? And this is without the use of springs! It's all you. You see the Maker Knife is adjustable. You can choose from a range of "almost impossible to open" to "wrist flick to open". Both offer great holding strength while retracted (no worrying about it opening in your pocket), and you can tune it to feel just the way you want it to feel.
It's also a fantastic feature for increasing the "child safety" factor of the knife as you can make it require a lot of force to open. (Obviously don't let kids anywhere near a knife of any kind though)
We made it for you, and us.
We love the utility knife blades because you can scrape, pry, cut, chop, stab, sand or whatever without worrying about them getting chipped, dull, bent or broken. They are cheap and easy to find at hardware stores, so you can just swap the blade when it gets worn out and have a new flawless, razor sharp edge in seconds.
          What we don't like is the lack of a good way to hold them. Most handles are bulky and heavy, mainly made for industrial applications. - That won't work for us makers!
What we need is a convenient, super quick knife that is lightweight and compact. A design that is made to be an EDC (Every Day Carry) item.
So we decided to make the Maker Knife.
Here we are, five months later, with a finished design. You would think designing a holder for a blade would be pretty straightforward right? But we didn't just want to make a stick and shove a blade on there. No, we wanted to make something so good that you would like to carry with you, all the time, every day.
Precision manufacuring
There were these extraordinarily complex problems that needed to be solved in order to achieve the magic feeling we were seeking. Some parts were impossible to mill using CNC machines, so we used extremely accurate EDM (Electrical Discharge Machining), making cuts that are no thicker than a human hair.
With a core of high strength stainless steel
Super quick to use in either hand
          It took many, many tries, prototypes and curse words to perfect this deceptively simple looking locking mechanism. A locking mechanism so intuitive and easy to use that you don't even think about it, you just use it, no matter which hand.
Some of the very early prototypes
You can even unlock the Maker Knife wearing thick gloves.
"You really don't have to think about using the Maker Knife. You're already done."
Did we mention it's waterproof?
"Unlocking the maker knife is the transition from a thought to an action. That is why we made it flawless."
The Maker Knife is available in two different finishes; Black or Silver.
The silver finish is very similar to a pretty well known computer model
The clip can be mounted on either side of the knife
Once the campaign is over, we will ask which finish you prefer, so you don't have to make this difficult decision just yet. Pledge now - choose later.
Materials
To ensure the best performance we made the core from high strength corrosion resistant stainless steel. The case is made from aerospace grade aluminium to keep the Maker Knife as light and agile as possible. This combination also means that the Maker Knife is waterproof.
Specs:
Height closed: 108mm
Height open: 140mm (with blade)
Width: 33mm
Thickness: 7.7mm
Weight: 65g (with blade)
About the thickness of a modern smartphone
This makes the Maker Knife very natural to carry
So that you can take it with you everywhere you go
This resulted in a knife that got its beauty through function
We really do believe we made the best utility knife. It's everything we ever wanted a utility knife to be. We think you will feel the same.
Ceramic blades
Ceramic utility knife blades? Yeah, they are really cool! Ceramic is really, really good at keeping an edge. You can cut foam, cardboard, leather, fabric and such and it will probably never go dull. It's fantastic for RC scratch builders, crafts, leather makers and many others.
But as always in life there are tradeoffs. Ceramic blades will chip when abused. Cutting very hard things like hard wood and such is not really its intended use. Use cheap metal blades that you can pick up local to you for stuff like that.
- Only available as part of the knife bundles during the Kickstarter-
Blades will be available on MakerKnife.com after the Kickstarter has ended. 
 The Diresta Maker Knife
Jimmy Diresta decided to launch a Diresta version of the Maker Knife with a custom brass top plate that he'll customize himself with his brand. The Diresta brass plate comes as an addition to the normal top plate in the color of your choice.
Diresta Maker Knife with Black Base
The Diresta Brass plate comes as an addition to the standard plate.
Help promoting this campaign by:
This project is promoted by Green Inbox Partner Program
Press Relations PressWisdom
 The Team
Two like-minded makers. The founder Giacomo (left) and the design partner David (right),
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
PLEASE BE ADVISED THAT THE REAL PRODUCT MIGHT DIFFER SLIGHTLY FROM PROTOTYPES SHOWN IN THE PICTURES ABOVE

All the funding will go towards making this project a reality. We need to make several molds and they can be quite expensive. It only makes sense to have them made if there is enough volume of parts being produced. That is why we are here on kickstarter! With your help we can make this tool. A tool we believe every makers will love. Makers unite to make a tool!

This is our first kickstarter project and it's going to be a excellent learning experience for us.
However it is not our first time doing product development and fulfilment. We have done both software and hardware before.

This has taught us a lot about the importance of finding quality suppliers. We have already spent a long time building relationships with the manufacturers we will use for this project and we feel pretty confident in their ability to deliver.

We feel well prepared, but like with any project there are always unforeseen challenges to overcome. We will try our utmost to deliver on time, but if we do run into any problems we will try to be as transparent as we can and communicate this to you here on kickstarter.

Thank you very much for supporting us in this endeavour. We hope you will be as happy with the Maker Knife as we are.
/Giacomo Di Muro with the help of David Windestål
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping update and a big thanks!
updates.update_content:
You guys are amazing!
Firstly, It's really amazing to get positive feedback on something we created. It's quite unreal to see something we designed being used by others and even better, being enjoyed!
We would like to thank each and every one of you that have posted on social media and reached out to us and sharing your experience with the Maker Knife.

If you need support the ONLY WAY TO REACH US IS: support@giaco.com
We are receiving more comments and emails about delivery than we can deal with.
Facts:
It's shipping time!

updates.update_userinfo: We are happy to report that things are going well with production!
updates.update_content:
We are on schedule to start shipping in December and by now you should have received an email asking if the address we have for is still correct.
Since it might have been some months ago that you entered it, some of you might have moved, or maybe you want your Maker Knife to be delivered to another address. We just want to make sure so that your Maker Knife arrives at the right place instead of being returned back to us.

We are very happy with the progress we are making. The companies are being communicative and parts are being made.
We will make another trip to China when most parts have been made and will personally set up the assembly line to ensure the quality. We will also stay there and sit in assembly line ourselves to imbue them with our love and speed up the process.
Since we are noobs at projects this scale it sure has been much more a jump into the deep end than planned. We are trying our best and learning every day.

campaign.story:
Hello Kickstarters, my name is Alain Benoit and I am exploring some of these symbols with the Cartomancer Poker Deck.
The inspiration behind my project. Tarot; French cartomancy; transformation deck; analytical psychology; art; surrealism; symbolism; fingerprints; vintage prints; and illustrations (to name only a few.) 
Why is this deck unique? Each card tells a story. The whole deck paints the landscape of our lives with vintage engravings and prints—the ideal synergy between significance and design in a pack of cards. There is nothing like it out there—that’s why I’m doing it! 
Cartomancy, divination? Yes, of course! The Catomancer Poker Deck uses the existing structure of a standard deck of cards as a canvas for a new insightful cartomancy system. ALL the cards feature universal archetypes and symbols making it a very instinctive tool for divination. But if you're not into this, you will still enjoy the deck for its beauty and uniqueness.
My dream will come true! When funded, each deck will be printed with the highest quality by the United States Playing Card Company. For me, the creation of this deck is THE quest to create playing cards I could see only in my dreams.
_____________________________
IMPORTANT: If you are from the United States, please select the rewards named “USA Shipping rate” or “USA” in order to get the proper price for your reward.
Diamond: Sensation, perception with our senses, childhood and earth. 
Spade: Thinking, becoming part of society, early adulthood and air. 
Heart: Intuition, abundance and fertility, midlife and water. 
Club:  Feeling, knowing without reasoning, late adulthood and fire.
As a tribute to the people who have gotten their hands dirty with ink creating the engravings featured in the deck, I have made the suit symbols with fingerprints. As a result, no suit symbol is ever repeated on the same card. For instance, the 10 of Diamonds has 10 different fingerprints!
The timeworn paper background of the front of each card is a section of a larger paper so that the background of each card is different (no annoying repeated markings anywhere.) Of course the backs are uniform for obvious reasons.
The meaning of each card is printed in the margin of the card in both English and French as a tribute to French Cartomancie.
The deck contains hundreds of engravings, sometimes as many as five different designs in the same card. There is always something new to discover every time you look at them.
Red Joker Unconsciousness: our deepest level of consciousness, a pool of desires, dreams, spirituality and emotions. 
Black Joker Consciousness: our individual awareness of the world: sensation, thinking, intuition and feeling. 
The ornaments on the tuck box and on the back of the cards are old foundry ornaments used in early printing.
I want to include with each deck a companion book. It will be a 32 page booklet the size of the box, containing an introduction to the deck, keyword meanings for each card, and ideas for divination. To produce the booklet and include it with each deck we need to reach the STRETCH GOAL of $16,500.
Uncut sheet
You can really appreciate the collection of images and the color scheme for each suit on the Cartomancer Poker Deck’s uncut sheet.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have spent many months working on every detail of this project to ensure that the production and shipping will be efficient and without issues. It's mainly for that reason that I have chosen not to include add-on items that could slow down the production of the deck itself.

The cards are designed and ready for production as soon as funded. If you have any questions at all, feel free to contact me. Thank you and I hope you enjoy the cards as much as I enjoyed creating them.

Alain
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: New Cartomancer Poker Decks on KS
updates.update_content:
Cartomancers!
It's been over 3 years since my last update. Since then, the Cartomancer Poker Deck that you backed in 2017 has been sold out. So, it's my pleasure to offer a reissue of the original Cartomancer Deck renamed "Clarity" and the brand new Cartomancer Shadow Deck. Together the two decks constitute the Cartomancer Duality project, live right now on Kickstarter (link below.)

The Cartomancer Poker Deck was the deck I could see only in my dreams until YOU made it possible as a Kickstarter backer. Thank you!
To celebrate, I’m giving away an uncut sheet (see image below.)
To participate:
Rewards of 2 decks on the assembly line...

Guess what came in today! You should have seen the smile on my face holding the uncut sheet! Everything looks AMAZING! Waiting for the companion booklet to get delivered from the printer to start sending out your rewards!  —Alain

Dear Cartomancers,
I’m finally close to shipping your Cartomancer Poker Deck rewards!
I want to thank all of you who have completed the Kickstarter survey confirming your shipping address. The survey will be open until February 16, you have until then to update your address if you need to.

Dear Cartomancer,  
It's going to be a great year: my baby, the Cartomancer Poker Deck, will get printed and will be delivered to you!
I spent the end of 2017 recreating the artwork of each card at a higher resolution to ensure the best reproduction quality for the linework of the etchings.

Dear Cartomancer,
It’s been almost two weeks since the Cartomancer Poker Deck was funded. Since then, I’ve been busy getting everything ready for the production of the decks by the USPCC. I’m also putting the finishing touches to the companion booklet. Everything is looking great!
I would like to share with you how incredibly rewarding it is for me to see that the deck has reached people from so many countries and cultures all around the globe. A total of 44 countries on 6 continents, see the map below (sorry Antarctica)!

THANK YOU ALL, my dream of producing this deck of cards is now a reality.   
Earlier today I threw 3 cards from my dummy Cartomancer Deck, my question was non-specific about the KS campaign and this project in general, now that it's going to the next stage. I felt really good about the cards I got and wanted to share them with you:

campaign.story:
Hi Kosmonauts! Last year we brought the KOSMOS Pen to life with your help. By now we shipped over 3000 pens around the world. Many of you have been waiting for a Titanium Version and after months of refinement we are finally able to present: the KOSMOS Titan.   
With your support we will be able to realize the production run of this ultimate Titanium Version of KOSMOS in two beautiful surface finishes. 
Just shift the Cap! - The magnetic forces inside KOSMOS are perfectly balanced. A strong Neodymium magnet holds the cap safely in the idle and writing position.
Fun to Play! - The simplest and most intuitive way to get a pen ready for writing: our new mechanism makes it possible.
Designed by Nature - The minimalistic design of KOSMOS is based on a universal pattern of nature: the Golden Ratio.
The best Material for a Lifetime Product - each part of KOSMOS is lathed from a solid block of highly durable Grade-5 Titanium.
The KOSMOS Titan is precision-machined out of solid Grade-5 Titanium. This remarkable material combines highest durability with exceptional light weight. We worked hard to achieve KOSMOS’ ultra-high tolerances with Titanium. The effort paid off: the magnetic mechanism works more smoothly than ever which gives the pen a unique feel of quality.
The Titan comes in two distinct finishes: a mirror polished version and a matt version.
The KOSMOS Titan comes in a redesigned matt-laminated premium packaging in all black.
The Mirror-Polished Version of Titan runs through multiple extensive polishing stages to make it shine like a mirror.
The Matt Version of Titan has a nice satin feel of the surface and is especially resistant against scratches.
The classic version of KOSMOS is precision-machined from solid Grade-6 Aluminium. It comes with a matt surface finish, which runs through a special anodisation process. This makes the pen very resistant against scratches and wear.
For this new Kickstarter campaign, we improved the functionality of the classic Aluminium KOSMOS entirely. This 2.0 version of our original pen is not available anywhere else yet. Same as the KOSMOS Titan it comes with refined tolerances and a even smoother mechanism.
You can choose from 3 reward tiers: the KOSMOS Titan in a single pack, the KOSMOS Titan in a 2-pack and the classic KOSMOS Aluminium. 
If you’d like to receive multiple rewards, simply add the respective amount to your pledge:
€89 KOSMOS Titan
€169 KOSMOS Titan 2-pack
€45 KOSMOS Aluminium
You will select the color you'd like to get in a Backerkit survey after the campaign.
The stilform Accessories will be available in the Backerkit Survey after the campaign.
To make your KOSMOS Pen truly the perfect everyday carry, we created a Leather Pouch that protects and holds it safely while you're on the go.
The Walnut Holder is the perfect place to keep your KOSMOS and present its design even better – wherever it may be: whether on your desk at work or at home in your living room.
   Specifications:
KOSMOS Titan Material: Grade-5 Titanium, Weight: 42
KOSMOS Classic Material: Grade-6 Aluminium, Weight: 26 g
Black Premium Cartridge with German Ink and Swiss Tungsten Tip included, Size M
Compatible with all G2 Standard Refills (Parker-Style Refills)
Gift Box Packaging
We have been working together with our trusted manufacturer for a long time. The production of the KOSMOS Titan is all set up and we have already produced a small batch of the polished version. In the process we gained valuable experience and resolved the production challenges of the Titanium material. So now we can make sure the production of all Kickstarter rewards runs as smoothly as possible.
To speed up the production process we arranged special condition with our manufacturer: We will order the raw material and start first lathing operations even before the campaign has ended. So you will receive your highly anticipated KOSMOS Titan as early as possible.
The final quality control of the pens will be done by ourselves personally. Afterwards a professional fulfillment partner will take care of the shipping of packages to your homes.
Sometimes the simplest things are the most profound. Attention to detail is of utmost importance when you want to look good.
Design and style should work toward making you look good and feel good without a lot of effort so you can get on with the things that matter. Follow us on our journey! - stilform
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main risks and challenges are as follows:

Production delays: 
We are working with extremely experienced machining and finishing suppliers that are used to handling quantities well over the amount that are typical for Kickstarter which means that there is little risk of a production bottleneck. Though it is unlikely, delays can still happen as machinery can break down, raw materials can arrive late etc. which can create unanticipated setbacks. If this highly unlikely scenario takes place, frequent communication and transparency with our backers is our top priority.

Pens are popular on Kickstarter so our funding goal could be exceeded significantly. Maintaining consistent quality - There are separate quality control procedures at every manufacturing step so defect rates are very low. We have the experience to realize high quality products through our background as a industrial design agency.

Shipping large volumes - If we will get highly overfunded, all products will be packaged and sent by a professional logistics warehouse so we will be able to pack shipments quickly and without mistakes.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The oloid is an intriguing and widely unknown geometric shape with amazing mathematical and aesthetic properties. It was discovered in 1929 by German sculptor, inventor and mathematician Paul Schatz.
 From art to toy, from math to joy...
A desktop sculpture that brings art, science, beauty and technology together in a single piece of solid metal. Perfect for thinkers, makers, visionaries, learners, teachers, and even for children.
Its hypnotic motion and flawless-smooth texture make it a great tool for stress-relief and concentration. A unique object that unleashes creative thinking and mindfulness.
UNLOCKED AT $1,000,000
The Black Oxide Oloid.
  The oloid is a striking, elegant piece that looks beautiful in your desk. Its fascinating shape is the perfect conversation starter.
 What is so special about the oloid?
Although its shape is curved, it moves in a perfect straight line. 
Although its shape is not round, it rolls. 
It has sharp edges, but its motion is gentle and smooth. 
While it rolls, every single point of its surface touches the ground.
Its surface area is identical to a sphere of the same radius.
It's surface is developable, meaning it can constructed from a flat sheet.
It has incredible functional properties; the oloid shape can be used for water treatment, as a propeller in navigation, or as stirrer in biotechnology.
  Made from liquid metal
We use a precision casting method to ensure every piece has the mathematical perfection of the oloid.
First, we create perfect wax oloids out of a precisely machined aluminum mold. These wax shapes are used for the casting process.
The wax shapes are dipped in different ceramic materials and melted in a furnace at 500º C. Then, molten metal is poured into the ceramic molds, which need to get destroyed afterwards to reveal the metal pieces.
The mysterious shape
If the distance of two centers of disk is equal to the radius, then the convex hull produces another figure that rolls smoothly and is known as the oloid. (Schatz 1975).
Due to his art studies and his discussion of questions relating to space and the zodiac, Paul Schatz discovered in 1929 that the Platonic solids could be inverted. In particular the Invertible Cube, elaborated in accordance with the respective laws, and its specific, rhythmic mobility were to become the basis upon which Paul Schatz was to build his Oloid.
The surface of the oloid is a developable surface, meaning that patches of the surface can be flattened into a plane. While rolling, it develops its entire surface: every point of the surface of the oloid touches the plane on which it is rolling, at some point during the rolling movement. 
Unlike most axial symmetric objects (cylinder, sphere etc.), while rolling on a flat surface, its center of mass performs a meander motion rather than a linear one. In each rolling cycle, the distance between the oloid's center of mass and the rolling surface has two minima and two maxima.
Rewards
*To order multiple Oloids, just select the reward you want and increase the reward amount by multiplying the reward cost by the number of Oloids you want.  
Specs
   Reward Upgrades and Add-Ons Guide

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Yes, unfortunately running a business and producing flat bottles can come with various risks. There is always inherent risk when bringing new products to market. Production delays can occur, and we are first to admit that we have definitely experienced them before. This is our second Kickstarter campaign, and the experience we gained 3 years ago (and the journey since) has been invaluable for the planning of this campaign. We are now well versed in the production process, and have taken all steps to ensure the process goes as smoothly as possible. 

But we don't like over-promising something - so here's a few potential risk areas, and how we have mitigated them. 

- Bottle production - quality. In our first campaign we hit a number of roadblocks - learning how to produce flat bottles with an offset neck, whilst maintaining good clarity and quality. There were months of back and forth with samples before we finally arrived at the final product. This time, we have done this grunt work in the lead up to this campaign, and have strong existing manufacturer relationships in place. 

- Soft good production - Manufacturing soft goods also has it's challenges. Maintaining a consistent quality of leather, fitment and stitching requires serious expertise. We've teamed up with Melbourne fashion label Kinnon to ensure that quality of the leather sleeves is top notch.

- Shipping and logistics - setting up a logistics system to effectively and efficiently ship to backers all over the world is not easy - and is a hugely time consuming process. After shipping to 72 countries in our previous campaign, we now have an established logistics network of 9 warehouses around the world
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: We are back... almost! A special offer and exciting things to come.
updates.update_content:
Hello Kickstarter Backers!
From all of us at membottle, we hope that you are all staying safe and looking after yourself during these uncertain times.
It has been a while since we have done an update. We have been working hard to get through the economic downturn, but have also taken this time to reflect on our mission and our product road map. We are excited to say that we will be launching a new Kickstarter Campaign later in the year. Unfortunately, we have to keep the details a secret for now.. But you’ll receive updates soon enough! We also have a string of product releases coming over the next couple of months.

updates.update_userinfo: LAST CHANCE TO INVEST IN MEMOBOTTLE! 12 HOURS TO GO!

project_data.project_name: memobottle H2.0

campaign.story:
Lofree Poison is a combination of vintage classic aesthetics and modern digital audio technology.
An enhanced bass driver pumps out powerful and full-bodied bass while not sacrificing mids and trebles. The Poison can play up to six hours of CD quality music wirelessly. Or you can instantly back the good ol’ days of radio channel surfing.
It comes with Venetian Red
 Pure White
Olive Green
Turquoise Blue
    Let us pay tribute to items from the past and give them new meaning today while memorizing ol’ good melodies.
Lofree Poison is a blend of 1950s radio with innovative modern technology which makes for a nostalgic classic gadget a modern coating. 
    Designed with acoustics in mind, we engineered the Bass Enhancement System that lets the Poison produce mids and trebles from the front, while an ultra large diaphragm in the back pumps out powerful, deep, full-bodied bass.
The meticulously designed housing went through five iterations. It’s been perfected to ensure a long lasting and stable bass performance.
  Does a tiny speaker mean weaker sound? No. With 20-watt amplifiers (two pieces of 10-watt amplifiers) processing audio output, the Poison sounds more vast than other speakers of similar size.
We’ve engineered renowned Waves® MaxxAudio Acoustic Solution that’s built into the speaker, so it can produce richer and full-bodied sounding content. The algorithms of sound perception(including noise and music) create a perceived low bass and compensate for the acoustic limitations of tiny devices. Waves received a Technical GRAMMY® Award in recognition of its outstanding contributions to the recording industry.
With a 2000mAh built-in rechargeable battery, Poison can play up to six hours of CD quality music wireless and portable. If you prefer to connect in another way, the Poison also lets you connect via the aux cable.
    Like a fine wine that became even more valuable with age. With a physical rotating dial for channel scanning, the Poison will bring back nostalgic memories of the good ol’ days of radio channel surfing.
Credit to @superphenblog
     Check out iDB’s review about the Poison here
      Design iteration
  Aging test and button life cycle test
A little change for a better experience
In order to have the Poison more durable that last for years and lower defective rates in production, we’ve decided to engrave functional symbols on the device’s buttons instead of the original silk printing.
We understand you may love the previous design. But after we tested three prototypes in the past few weeks, we think the latest version offers the best user experience.
  When you combine love and free, you get lofree. We all come from a designer's background - as reflected in our product. We dedicate ourselves to keep the most sophisticated product simple and elegant, in order to benefit and reach more people. We push boundaries in product design and have won several Red Dot and iF design awards. We love the way of life. This is lofree.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With a successful crowdfunding of Lofree Keyboard on Indiegogo, we are confident that we can get support across the globe if we continue to make great stuff. That’s why we are launching the Poison on Kickstarter. We want to prove that a tiny speaker can pump out superior sound by improving the housing structure and sound tuning. Since this is our first time making a speaker, we faced lots of challenges, such as molding, user experience, battery consumption and acoustic tuning. Our team worked around the clock in the past few months. Finally, we have overcome all of the problems, hence our Kickstarter campaign, and mass production soon!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Sending some eggciting treats your way…
Meet Lofree’s New Product -- Digit Number Pad live on Kickstarter now!
updates.update_content:
Hi Lofree fans,
After months’ of waiting, we are finally meeting up with you on Kickstarter!
Digit, the latest Lofree product - versatile as hell, a wireless, retro, mechanical Number Pad & Calculator, all in one!
The Digit is both beauty and brains. Do your daily calculations and pound on the numbers with the most satisfying tactile feel ever. It will become an indispensable working companion on your desk set!

We’re exactly a month away from Black Friday! The biggest shopping day of the year where everyone’s adrenaline is running high off of the great deals available. We’re here to give the best discounts of them all! FREE.

updates.update_userinfo: Digit Calculator - From the Makers of the Poison Speaker!
updates.update_content:
Hey Poison Backers! 
Thanks for loving the Lofree design and your continual support. After months of designing and developing, we just launched a new product that we’re so excited to introduce to you!

updates.update_userinfo: Tell Us Your Experience, Your Opinion Matters To Us
updates.update_content:
Dear friends,
We have respectively launched Lofree keyboard and Poison speaker over the last 425 days, We’re so enthusiastic and eager to tell them that, after 11-month of hard work and dedication, our latest creation, QTV speaker has begun its journey of Crowdfunding.
To express our gratitude for your support, we have an exclusive offer for our return customers, the best deal ever.

updates.update_userinfo: QTV: New Episode of Lofree’s Retro Aesthetics
updates.update_content:
Dear friends,
Attributed to your love and support, our dream has come true since March 2017. To allow someone like you, with a unique taste of high tech product, to experience our products, we have previously asked for recommendation of quality distributors from part of you guys, so that we can offer you comprehensive after-sales service in your country.
We’ve been discussing with some recommended distributors, due to confidentiality obligations during the negotiations, we would like to withhold the details until everything is all set, so let's drop it for this moment. However, we are pleased to inform you that we are negotiating with some European distributors, we believe that a good number of retail stores in the cities of Europe will carry Lofree within this year. Of course, we are also working hard to build a partnership with a distributor in other regions. Also, we are planning to add a sale channel on the Lofree official website (www.lofree.co) in the next few months, and we will share with you more about the design and interesting behind-the-scenes stories on Lofree’s craftsmanship and innovation, stay tuned!

campaign.story:
Liberty® Bottleworks has designed, manufactured, printed, and sold Liberty® bottles from our factory in Union Gap, Washington— the heart of the Pacific Northwest—since 2011.  
We’re now ready to launch our second American-made product—Liberty® double-walled tumblers. These tumblers keep drinks hot or cold on the inside while the outside stays comfortable to the touch. 
Because we built our factory with contributions from hundreds of private investors—no banks—we only purchased the equipment needed to produce our original, patented Liberty® bottles. This Kickstarter will help us retool our equipment so we can reduce the cost of the tumblers so anyone can afford an American-made, metal, double-walled tumbler. 
Our high quality, sustainable metal water bottles and tumblers are built in a plant that does not negatively impact the environment while providing living wage jobs right here in our local community. 
 In addition, our products help you demonstrate your individuality. You can choose the color, the design, and the message you want to share with the world. Our state-of-the-art printing process allows you to tell your story, in color, with texture, and in your own words. Our designers can create custom art or you can create your own and we will build a bottle or tumbler just for you. 
Here is a sample of the tumblers, bottles, and products we developed for you in return for your contribution to our Kickstarter campaign. 
   Tell your friends about our campaign!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We can currently manufacture the tumbler using our existing machinery. However, because the equipment was not originally designed for this purpose it is fairly expensive to produce. This Kickstarter will help us retool our equipment so we can reduce the cost of the tumblers so anyone can afford an American-made, metal, double-walled tumbler.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
The last of the tumbler components have arrived, and we have started assembling and shipping our first backer kits! 
Thanks again to all 1294 of our backers for help us produce this great product!
All of the kits should all be mailed out within the next week, so you should see your limited edition tumblers, bottles, hats, and stickers in plenty of time for Christmas.

Thanks again to everyone who has supported us! We have been working hard at producing the first double-walled metal tumbler, made exclusively in the US! 
Items have started arriving for the backer kits, and we received our first functional molded prototype components this week. Things are starting to come together, and we are still planning to begin shipping tumblers and backer kits in late November!
Stay tuned!

updates.update_userinfo: 2,000 Liberty® bottles donated to homeless shelters across the US!
updates.update_content:
Your generous donations to our Kickstarter campaign, where pledge levels included our donation of Liberty® bottles, have now made it possible for us to send water bottles to homeless shelters across the US! 
We want to thank everyone who supported us! It’s so important to us that we give back to our country and help local communities. Without your help, we could never have succeeded, and we wouldn’t be able to make this difference in lives of people who are homeless.

updates.update_userinfo: Check out a new USA-made Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
We have reached our goal! 
What does this mean? It means we will be able to produce the first double-walled metal tumbler, made exclusively in the US! 
Thank you to everyone who made a pledge to our Kickstarter! If you haven't made a pledge yet, you still have 3 days left to purchase your own double-walled tumbler and Liberty® products at a major discount! With every pledge, you are making a direct impact in supporting US manufacturing and increasing US jobs.

We’re 84% to our goal, with only 10 days left! Thank you so much to everyone who supported us. You’re awesome, and we could never have done this without you!
If you haven’t already, please share our Kickstarter with your friends and family. We just need one last push to help us reach our goal by July 29th.
While you’re on Kickstarter, be sure to check out our friends over at Zendure. They’ve made a cool travel adapter so you can charge all your devices no matter where you go, and they’re made in America! Check it out

If you have any family reunions or a need for a large quantity order of single-walled or double-walled tumblers, we have launched three new pledge levels on Kickstarter. Each with the ability to receive your single-walled bottle order within 3-4 weeks of pledging!
 Pledge $2,500 on our Kickstarter and you will receive: 
 144 fully customized 24oz single-wall bottles! Any color. Any cap style. Full wrap, full color customization. Delivery within 3-4 weeks.
 -- OR --

campaign.story:
Overview
Every day, we use pens in our work and personal lives. The Bona Fide Pen is a writing instrument designed for people that appreciate the quality and durability of machined pens and enjoy using them. The ergonomic design of the Bona Fide Pen combined with it's sturdy construction makes this pen an excellent choice as your every day pen. I hope this pen becomes part of your every day carry gear.
The Bona Fide Machined Pen - Silver Anodized
I enjoy using a quality fountain pen at my desk. I wanted a pen that had the feel and classic styling of the pens I was already using, but also had the durability and strength to withstand the abuses of being used everyday, outdoors and in the field. I wanted a pen that was quick to deploy and return to my pocket with one hand. For this reason, the Bona Fide Pen needed to be a retractable pen. I also wanted a pen that used refills that could meet the diverse needs of the user and were readily available. Like the name Bona Fide suggests, this pen had to be genuine, reliable and built to earn your trust. It's Bona Fide!  
Materials
Because I wanted a sturdy pen, it had to be made entirely of metal without the use of any plastic. I experimented with stainless steel, aluminum, brass, copper and even titanium. The steel, brass and copper make beautiful pens but the weight of those metals proved to be too heavy for prolonged use.
I finally decided on 6061 aluminum that had the best combination of machinability, strength, corrosion resistance and cost. 6061 aluminum will also accept a durable protective anodized finish that will keep the pen looking great even after years of use.
Design
Here is the criteria I used while designing this pen: 
Appealing classic style
Ergonomic pen geometry
Quality materials and construction
Precision fit and feel
Comfortable to hold and use
Dependable retracting mechanism
A good variety of popular refill options
Good price/value ratio
The starting point for the design of this pen was with the grip section. I like the way traditional fountain pens taper in towards the tip and then flare out again. This shape provides your fingers with a comfortable position properly spaced from the tip for writing and drawing. It also prevents your fingers from sliding down. Pens with sharp grooves or knurling can be irritating after prolonged use.
The undercut concave tip is inspired by the traditional nib shape found on fountain pens and adds style, strength and a clear view of where the tip meets the paper.
The Bona Fide pen is made with two slightly different designs machined into the barrel portion. The 'pinstripe' design has seven thin lines spaced 45 degrees apart along the barrel. The 'stars & stripes' design has the same lines as the 'pinstripe' style with the addition of eight evenly spaced stars, one above each of the seven pinstripes and one above the pocket clip.
Top: Pinstripes - Bottom: Stars & Stripes
  The two piece body of the pen is built strong with robust M10 threads and an extended shoulder to ensure smooth, positive alignment where the pen barrel and grip section meet. I chose the M10 x 1.0 thread because it has a pitch diameter that perfectly splits the distance between the inner wall and the outside of the pen. This provides the greatest overall strength where these parts connect.
   M10 Threads
  Fully Disassembled
   We looked at a number of retracting mechanisms with the goal of finding one that was precision made and extremely durable. I consulted with Jack Roman (a great guy by the way) of Tuff Writer MFG who has agreed to supply us with his superior retracting mechanism. This American made Tuff Writer mechanism surpasses all others in quality and reliability and features an improved raceway and 416 stainless steel construction.
Photo courtesy of Tuff Writer MFG.
The spring is custom made in the USA to our specifications from 316 stainless steel.
The Clip
Recessed Clip Attachment
The pocket clip on the Bona Fide Pen is made from 301 spring stainless steel and was specifically designed for this pen. The clip is laser cut and brake formed right here in Southern Oregon. The clip is then deburred and hand finished. Finally the clip is rigidly mounted to the pen in a close tolerance precision cut recess with two #2-56 stainless steel screws. Having the clip in a recess prevents the clip from moving and getting loose. 301 spring stainless steel resists corrosion and maintains its shape and spring retention. The clip has a slight pre-load tension and will be secure in your shirt or pants pocket or in your notebook.  
Machining
The Bona Fide Pen design required a machine that can produce small, complex precision parts. I worked with Jay MacDonald of Precision CNC Products, also here in Grants Pass, Oregon, and chose the Star CNC Swiss-type Automatic Lathe to manufacture the pen.
We were able to make the pen barrel and grip section with all the design features I wanted while maintaining precise tolerances and a beautiful machined finish that was ready for anodizing.  
Finishing 
The pen barrel and grip section are then inspected for fit and finish. After the machined aluminum parts are inspected they are anodized to give the pen a resilient finish that will keep the pen looking great and performing perfectly. Anodizing is an electro-chemical process that converts the metal surface into a decorative, durable, corrosion resistant, aluminum oxide finish. We anodize in silver, black, blue and gold.
Ballpoint Refills 
When deciding on which refill the Bona Fide Pen would be designed to use, my first candidate was the pressurized refill made by the Fisher Pen Co. The Fisher Space Pen refill is a popular choice because of it's ability to write upside down and write on slick surfaces. It is a great choice for people who work and write outdoors.
Realizing that users of this pen will have different preferences, I wanted to be sure this pen could accept a wider variety of refills that met different needs. I eventually modified the pen design to accept refills that conform to an industry standard, the Parker DIN ISO 12757 specification. The Fisher Space Pen refill also works perfectly in this pen when used with the Parker adapter that comes with the Fisher refill.
While reviewing the many refills available I came across the Schmidt easyFLOW 9000 refill. This highly rated ballpoint refill makes a smooth and solid line much like a rollerball. The Bona Fide pens will be delivered with two Schmidt easy FLOW 9000 refills, one black and one blue.
 Balance
We had a question about the pen balance. Here is a photo to show the balance point of the pen by itself. The pen has a neutral balance feel in average sized hands. I have large hands and when writing I find the pen rests slightly on my fingertips if I release my grip.
Pen Balance

updates.update_userinfo: Buy a Bona Fide Pen and Save $10
updates.update_content:
We hope you are enjoying your Bona Fide Machined Pen. If you are considering another pen for yourself or as a gift, we are offering a $10 discount code for our Kickstarter supporters. Enter the code (KS10SAVE) at the checkout on our website and receive a $10 discount on each Bona Fide Pen in your order. We also have FREE SHIPPING on all US orders.
We have medium and fine tip Schmidt refills available on the website too.
https://bonafideproducts.com
We received the pens back from anodizing on Friday. They are stunning. I posted some photos here for you to see. We are assembling the pens over the holiday weekend and shipping starts next week.

updates.update_userinfo: Update on the Bona Fide Kickstarter Pens
updates.update_content: The machining on the final group of Kickstarter Pens is complete. They look fantastic. The pens are out getting anodized right now. Our anodizer said he will be finished by the end of the week. We will start shipping them out shortly after we get them back. You will get an email notification with tracking information when your pen ships. We really appreciate the support from all of our backers. -John & Kristin

updates.update_userinfo: Started Shipping Early Bird Rewards Today
updates.update_content: The first half of the Early Bird Reward Pens were shipped today. It is a lot of work. We made every effort to pay attention to the details. We hope everyone will love their new pens. Here are some photos of the assembly. We will ship the remaining Early Bird Reward Pens tomorrow. The Any Style/Any Color Pens are on schedule for delivery in August.

We are getting very busy around here. Although we are still waiting to receive funds from KickStarter (it takes 14-20 days) it is not slowing us down a bit. The out-sourced parts are ordered and we are tooling up the machines here so we can deliver the rewards as soon as possible. We will continue to post updates as milestones are met. Here is a glimpse of some pen tips already made.

updates.update_userinfo: Thank You! The Bona Fide Pen is Now a Reality!
updates.update_content:
Here is a quick update. The campaign ended on Friday at 5:00pm with $12,886 raised, over 250% of our goal. We are pleased beyond our expectations.
We are finishing up the surveys and will send them out to all of our backers by Tuesday the 13th. The survey will give you a way to give us your contact information, shipping address and pen (reward) preferences if your level of support had color or style options.
We will be posting more updates here to keep you fully informed of our progress toward delivering the pens.

updates.update_userinfo: One Last Day To Support This Project!
updates.update_content: We want to give a special thank you to our 100+ backers for their support in making this project a great success. We are currently funded at over $12,000, almost 250% of our original goal! There is just one more day until our KickStarter campaign for the Bona Fide Pen ends. Please help us push our numbers up one last time by sharing it with your friends!

The video and description photos are now updated to show the upgraded retracting mechanism manufactured by Tuff Writer MFG. We also added a close up image of the threads that join the pen barrel and grip section. Take a look!

updates.update_userinfo: Project Goal Reached - Thank You to All Our Backers!
updates.update_content: Tuesday evening at 9pm, one week after we launched the Bona Fine Pen project, we reached our funding goal. We want to thank all of our backers for their trust and support. All of us are busy getting production scheduled and packaging finalized. We just finished shooting new photographs and video that show the pens with the upgraded click mechanism mentioned in our last update. This Kickstarter page will have those new images soon.  Don't forget to share this project with your Facebook friends. Thanks again.

campaign.story:
Our team has spent years working with glow resins and improving their overall qualities for glow strength and longevity. We love to let our imaginations run wild with ways to use these resins in fun and functional ways. Creating the FireFly zipper pull was an idea that bounced around for a while in our minds. When we finally made prototypes and went on our first camping trip with them we were amazed at just how much everyone loved them and how functional they really were. We hope this product finds a place at campsites around the world and brings help and joy to all who use them.  
Meet FireFly!
        We ultimately wanted the FireFly to be a simple product for adults and children alike. It had to be durable enough for an adult to put wear and tear on it and easy enough for a child to throw it on and off a zipper.  
After sampling all sorts of clasps and enclosures for attaching the glow resin bead and connecting to zippers and other object, we settled on paracord.
Paracord is a lightweight nylon kernmantle rope originally used in the suspension lines of parachutes. This cord is useful for many other tasks and is now used as a general purpose utility cord by both military personnel and civilians. This versatile cord was even used by astronauts during the 82nd Space Shuttle mission to repair the Hubble Space Telescope. 
The glowing bead on the firefly is a high grade high density glow powder infused Epoxy Resin bead. The way we produce the epoxy eliminates voids in the resin and is infused with an extremely high density of photo-luminescent powder so the glow is more vibrant and longer lasting than standard glow materials available on the market.
                                           PARACORD COLOR OPTIONS:
 GLOW BEAD COLOR OPTIONS:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with most projects like this, the main challenge is managing fulfillment. Because each firefly is made and finished by hand, a significant amount of time and care is put into every one we make, which could take longer than our estimated time frame for a large quantity of orders. However, our dedicated team has been perfecting this process for several months and we feel confident about our ability to deliver everything on time. There’s also the challenge of acquiring enough materials, but we’ve established a strong 3 year relationship with our chosen suppliers and have prepared them for every new product we launch.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
I’m so sorry for the lack of updates. We’ve had some changes here that occurred in 2017 that set this whole thing way back. We are recommitting to getting this project wrapped up. We are 2/3rds of the way complete. We have been working on making more fireflies and we have a bunch ready to go. In addition we are going to dedicate some extra time each week specifically on getting fireflies made and shipped.
I am so sorry it has taken so long. We’ve gone through some major changes and it’s caused quite a back log. We feel we are finally in control and we will get the remaining orders shipped!

Hey all, you guys have all been amazingly patient, when we started this campaign we never imagined we'd fall so far behind on production timelines and I'm sure you never imagined it when you pledged. we haven't had updates lately as we've been heads down in full swing, we're now producing at a full clip and delivering daily, many of you may have seen shipping notifications over the past couple of weeks. we're probably halfway fulfilled now and cranking to get this done asap. 
if you're curious where you fall in production you can shoot us an email at runerefinery17@gmail.com otherwise you can have confidence we're still cranking and getting to you as soon as possible.
We've finally started shipping the Fireflies! We are pulling some over time to get them out and they will start moving at a nice steady pace! Be on the look out!
We are back on track! We've been pumping out Fireflies like crazy! We will start shipping very very soon!

We have some great news and not great news. The great news is we have all the glow rods done. The not great news is, we're behind on production. We are so sorry about this, but we are actively looking to hire a 5th person who is 100% dedicated to the fireflies. We are hoping to have a solution here pretty quickly. We appreciate those that have been patient and have been kind!

First, Happy 4th of July! It is Independence Day here and we wanted to wish everyone a happy 4th of July and remind you to have fun and be safe.
Second, we have all the rods done for the fireflies. They will start to fly off the lathes soon! We're working out the production process and have TONS of paracord on the way as well as some boring bars on the way. No they aren't boring as in not fun, they are for boring holes in the rods.
We've got glow rods!!!!!! Tons of them! Hundreds of feet of them! They are bright and glorious and we will be starting on the beads soon! These things are so bright!

We've got some great news! We're almost done with the glow rods to make all the fireflies! This is a big deal because this is the biggest obstacle we faced in producing so many fireflies. these pictures are pretty raw so don't judge too harshly. They are shot on a mobile device rather than a nice DSLR camera. But we wanted to share because they are rad. Beyond rad. Like Friggin Cool! We're so stoked for these and that they came out so well. This makes our life so much easier in producing them in mass.

Okay, we've sent the revised surveys to allow mix and matching of colors. I hope we got this right this time. They took a while to build so please make sure to check your messages and fill out the survey so we can get started. We've already ordered a ton of materials for this and we should be getting started on production soon. Thank you EVERYONE for your patience and understanding during the survey fiasco of 2017!

We've redone the surveys for the 3, 5 and 10 firefly backers. We just sent out the redo survey for the people that just backed for 5 fireflies to start so we can make sure it's working properly. We had to erase all the data from the first surveys from the 3,5 and 10 surveys so please don't hate our guts for making you redo it. 
We will have the surveys resent tomorrow.

campaign.story:
The Spyslide Webcam Cover
The Spyslide Metallic Silver
World's thinnest webcam cover (0.6mm/0.023 inch) 
Installed in 5 seconds
Cover your webcam at your convenience
Beautifully layered in a Matte Black or Metallic Silver coating
Made from platinum durable stainless steel
Simply "slide" your Spyslide open and closed
  Stretch Goal €50,000 = UNLOCKED
Pledge 30€ or more, and receive a FREE Kickstarter Green Spyslide! 
  As Seen On
"Spyslide does exactly what you expect from it, and does it well." - Techaeris
"Spyslide is by far the best webcam cover I ever used" - Elie, Lead Google Security Team
Wait. What is a "webcam cover"? 
A webcam cover is a practical hardware solution that guarantees that no one is spying on you. As more and more reports are being published on the dangers of webcam hacking, the urgency of covering your webcam is at an all time high!
But is using that ugly sticker really the optimal way to cover your webcam and secure your digital privacy?
  What you should know about webcam spying.
*Factual information about webcam hacking starting at [02:15]. 
"I was shocked to learn the capabilities of many software tools people can buy online for 29,99$ saying "spy on your ex-girlfriend software" that you can install on someone’s computer”.
To read the whole article, click here. 
  We made covering your webcam elegant & effortless!
Other webcam covers are:
Expensive
Difficult to install
Consisting out of 2 parts, that are easy to lose
Too thick
Overall, impractical
The Spyslide Webcam Cover is:
One solid gadget that installs in just 5 seconds
The thinnest on the market, just 0.6mm / 0.023 inches thin
Simply slide open and close
Affordable. We included FREE worldwide shipping!
Spyslide Matte Black Edition
  Spyslide Metallic Silver Edition
  Fits perfectly on all laptops, desktops, and tablets!
   Thin enough (0.6mm) to close your laptop.
 Even far thinner than a paperclip!
      World's thinnest (0.6mm) and most compact webcam cover!
       Is the Spyslide suitable for smartphones?
Absolutely! For most of them, it is, but smartphones come in many shapes and that is why we cannot 100% guarantee it will perfectly fit on all. 
For example, the iPhone 6 & 7 both have camera's that are slightly raised from its surface, and are therefore not compatible with ANY webcam cover. 
             Installed in less than 5 seconds!
  Free Worldwide Shipping!
  Rewards:
*All prices include free world wide shipping! 
*Prices in $ (USD) are an indication price and may fluctuate
Next Stretch Goal: €150.000: Spyslide Color Voting Poll
Once we have reached our second Stretch Goal of €150.000 we will send out a Voting Poll to find out which color we will add. 
After our campaign is finished you can choose if you would like to receive your Spyslide in our current Matte Black option, the Metallic Silver option, or your new chosen colour. 
To ensure that you get your Spyslide in your favorite color, help us reach our new goal of €150.000 by spreading word of our product to your friends and family! 
Our Journey
        First Testimonials & Product reviews
Techaeris
Tech Times
Hackread
MS Poweruser
twitter.com/elie/status/836977646449745920
  About the makers:
Firstly, thank you for your involvement up to this point and for that alone we are very grateful! Allow us to briefly introduce the team behind this project:
We are Ties & Peter, 2 guys in our mid-twenties born and raised in the Netherlands.
We were annoyed by the stickers and post-its on our laptops and we decided to develop a better alternative to secure our online privacy. Our first prototype was actually made by Ties' dad (thanks!), which is where it all started.
We are confident that our dedication and time to our work has resulted in an incredible device that exceeds all the needs in a webcam cover. Please help us make this phenomenal security project a reality by supporting us here on Kickstarter!
Safety in aesthetic simplicity is what we value!
    Style and protect your friends
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Perfectly operating, and thoroughly tested production samples are already in our hands, and have produced a small trial batch from a highly reliable supplier! All in all we are 100% ready to start production on a larger scale.

However, 'life is like a box of chocolates (Forest Gump, 1994)' meaning unexpected things can happen. If it does, we will keep you up to date. We are very confident in handling any bumps along the way, while continuing to be an asset to the digital age!

Important notice: 
All our Spyslides except the Business & Corporate Box will be shipped with Regular Mail. Therefore take into account the Regular Mail conditions in your country. We will add a possibility to have it shipped with a tracking code at our final backer survey to guarantee the safely arrival of your Spyslides. 

Thank you for believing in us and if you have any questions please contact us at info@spy-fy.com!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
What is the Storyclock Notebook?
The Storyclock Notebook is a notebook designed for turning your ideas into stories.
The Storyclock Notebook
I’m Seth Worley. I’m a Los Angeles-based writer and director of online shorts (like Old/New, Real Gone and Plot Device) and branded content for clients like Bad Robot and Red Giant. I created the Storyclock Notebook as a research and development tool for writers like me.
Ooh Aah, That's How It Always Starts
In my experience, I've found that the second best part of writing is the beginning (the first best is finishing), when inspiration strikes and it feels like someone is beaming the story to your brain from an alternate dimension.
You're not so much making it up as transcribing it, relaying it. Your ideas at this point are like tribbles, growing and growing off of each other.
...Until they're not.
The transmission eventually stops, and you're left with a pile of disjointed and half-baked ideas. And now it's up to you to turn them into a story.
Now just turn this mess into a story. No bigs.
Cut to: the Storyclock Notebook.
Picture Your Story Like a Clock
The Storyclock Notebook utilizes the simple method of visualizing your story like a clock.
Seeing your story this way can quickly give you a bird's eye view of it, and reveal where your gaps are.
There's a gap.
And rather than filling these gaps by making stuff up and dropping in ideas from the outside, you can extract ideas from what you already have -- using symmetry.
What’s happening on the opposite sides of the clock? Anything you can set up or pay off?
It's a simple and effective exercise to fill the gaps in your story with relevant and meaningful material, born from what you already have.
This doesn't mean Lawrence Kasdan wrote Raiders with a story clock, but it demonstrates that good stories have a "rhythm and rhyme."
A Research + Development Tool
Think of the Storyclock Notebook as a research and development tool. The first half of the book is devoted to studying and analyzing existing stories, with the second half devoted to developing your own. 
This is a Development page. The left is where you dump your brain, and the right is an empty clock to start laying out your ideas in a narrative structure, and start filling out your story.
   This is a Research page. Sometimes it helps to rip off-- er-- STUDY the choices of other writers, so we've devoted the first half of the book for clocking existing stories.
 Purpose-Built for All Kinds of Stories
We designed the Storyclock Notebook for screenwriters, but it works for other storytelling mediums, too!
It's not just for screenwriters!
Built-in Resources
On the inside covers we’ve put a bunch of storytelling resources to serve you in your quest.
Nerd stuff!
  A general story structure guide and list of archetypes inspired by much smarter people like Joseph Campbell, Blake Snyder, and basically everyone at Pixar.
  A page/time converter that comes in handy far more often than you'd expect.
The Design
The Storyclock Notebook was designed to be both practical and creatively inspiring, a tool for perspiration and inspiration. Something that makes you WANT a reason to use it. For this we ended up leaning on old industrial handbooks and research logs to find the look and feel.
The touch... the feel... of industry!
There are 12 Research Logs and 12 Development Logs, a couple pages in the back for miscellaneous notes, and a table of contents page in the front for easy referencing and filing of your endless ideas and research.
Printing the Notebooks
Guten Co. letterpresses all of our covers in San Antonio, TX, where the Earth's gravitational pull is optimal for letterpressing journal covers.
Our friends at Guten Co. will be letterpressing the covers of the notebooks at their studio in San Antonio, TX.
Guten Co. was indispensable in the development of the Storyclock Notebook, helping us source materials and finish proofs so we could field test it and get as close to the finished product as possible before revealing it to the world.
If you’re looking to letterpress anything (i.e. business cards, invitations, posters that say WANTED in huge letters) or want some sweet handmade ceramic goods (seriously, come on), check out Guten Co!
Because the binding process is tedious to do by hand, we will print the interiors and bind the notebooks together at a larger company in Nashville, TN, where we will also pack + ship them out to our backers.
Specs
5.5x7” Finished Trim Size; 52 Pages
Cover: Neenah Environment “Weathered” 110# Cover
Interior Pages: 80# Cougar Text - Natural
Who's Responsible?
The Storyclock Notebook was created by me (Seth Worley), designed by Micah Lanier, and produced by Anne Fogerty.
Teamwork!
Why Kickstarter?
Just gimme it.
Well firstly, I really want this notebook. We’ve had a small number of proofs printed over the course of developing this, and I’ve ended up using it to write 2 feature-length screenplays, a tv pilot, 3 inspirational talks, 2 company presentations, and a wedding toast. Oh and a Kickstarter video.
Maybe? Maybe?
I feel like other people could benefit from this as much as I have, and Kickstarter is a great way to find out how right or wrong I am about that. After being involved in other friends’ campaigns and backing several projects over the years, I’ve been able to see and experience firsthand the unique benefits Kickstarter has over traditional development routes - the biggest being YOU. By releasing the storyclock notebook on Kickstarter, I’m able to get your feedback and input before we ever print it, ensuring that by the time it makes it to your hand, it’ll be the best possible version of itself.
Extra Extras!
Along with the notebook, we'll be offering extra awesome tools and resources in higher tiers to help you on your story quest, including:
Video Tutorial - A short video from Seth to help you make the most of the notebook.
Writing 101 Pack ($55 Value) - 11 videos from Seth walking through the basics of story structure, character, theme, and a comprehensive walk-through of outlining a story in the form of a clock.
Writing 201 Pack ($60 Value, Pre-Release) - The highly-anticipated sequel to the Writing 101 pack, not-yet-released!
Skype with Seth (Pricelesssss) - Get 30 minutes of Seth's time to talk about whatever you want.*
*Mostly to talk about stories. Keep it PG (maybe PG-13 because Seth acts like a 13-year-old [not really (ok yeah kind of really)]).
What Do I Get?
We've got several reward tiers to cater to your personal (notebook-related) desires:
Where is my money going?
Since we’ve already done most of the development of this notebook (believe it or not we’ve been working on it for two years), your contribution will go towards:
Notebooks - letter-pressing the covers in Texas, printing the interiors in Nashville, and binding the books in Nashville as well (because these are physical goods, every notebook purchased adds extra cost).
Reimbursement for Development Costs - We’ve already spent money to get this off the ground (illustration costs, fonts, proofs, etc) and so this will help pay people for the work they’ve done.
Fees - Kickstarter is awesome and because it costs money for them to operate we’ll owe them some money. And also credit card fees. We factored all of this into our goal amount.
We chose $12,500 because we think that number will help us at least hit breakeven on the cost to produce these notebooks. If we bring in “extra” money - which depends on how many backers we have for each tier, we hope to include some fun surprise flavor for you when you receive your notebooks.
Where you at?
You can follow us on Instagram at @StoryclockNotebook, or follow me on Twitter at @awakeland3d.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've spent a couple of years developing this notebook, and we're super excited to be sending it out into the world. At this point, as weird as it sounds, the biggest risk and challenge to us is not meeting our goal. If we don't meet our goal, these notebooks will not see the light of day (other than the 10 proofs that we printed). We're asking you to help us by backing the project and/or telling your friends about it!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Hey there backers! We wanted to let you know about a brand new product we launched last week: the Storyboard Workbook!
Welcome to 2019! Did you know that scientists actually consider January 15th the first day of the year? No need to look it up, it's definitely true.

If you’re reading this, you are either:
1. One of our awesome Kickstarter backers who’s putting their notebook(s) to use*
2. Someone who just stumbled upon this campaign to find that it’s over.
3. A wizard.
Whoever you are, we have good news for you.
Today we’re launching Plot Devices, the new home of the Storyclock Notebook… and MORE!
