campaign.story:
This Kickstarter was created to fund a series of original bookplates that identify your ownership while also allowing you to inscribe your books with a protective curse of your own creation.
So, what's a Book Curse?
Serving suggestion.
In very ancient days the creation of books, manuscripts, tablets and scrolls was an exacting and laborious process. Scribes worked meticulously to perfectly reproduce and record cultural, religious, and political records using expensive materials that were designed to last for centuries. So important was the veracity of these documents that in the unfortunate occasion of a mistake, the document would often be destroyed so as to not perpetuate any errors.
Of equal importance to the accuracy of these artifacts was their care and protection. Therefore, it was common practice to invoke the wrath of gods and all manner of supernatural havoc upon any who would seek to edit, steal, or destroy any of these works. This protection took the form of what is now referred to as a Book Curse.
How delightful!
The Book Curse bookplates
Inspired by the idea of an 'Ex Libris' bookplate that doubled as dire warning for any potential book thieves, I set my poisoned pen to the illustration of a set of Book Curse bookplates!
Mark your precious books as your own with sexy, sexy bookplates that you can write your own protective curses upon. All tiers include the cost of shipping! Worldwide! Please note that beyond postage, all additional duties, fees, and tariffs are the responsibility of the International backers.
Now make a pledge and be done with it already!
The most petty annoyance or eternity in a flesh-rending hell-- just write it in there yourself.
What your support... supports
As a meticulous artist and painstaking craftsman, I've invested in my own printing and production equipment and have produced my own fine art prints for years. Supporting this project will help to defray the costs of upgrading my print equipment while allowing me to produce these bookplates for you!
A percentage of the proceeds will also be earmarked for funding other crowdsourced projects. Learn more about Kicking It Forward at http://kickingitforward.org.
How are the bookplates made?
For the sake of the majority of readers, I opted for a self-adhesive solution instead of non-adhesive leafs that required a separate adhesive. Every 3.33" x 4" label is printed with Epson Durabrite pigmented inks and acid- and lignin-free self-adhesive papers. These bookplates are designed for permanent adhesion that will last for years without yellowing and a lifetime without fading. It is as close to an archival self-adhesive solution as is possible at the Maker level of production!
The Art of the Book Curse
Before and after, from rough to final.
Here are the designs that I have planned for this first edition of the bookplates. The final printed artwork will be high resolution. I've posted concept sketches, as well as a couple of printed prototypes using the final artwork:
Memento Mori (prototype, final artwork)
  Trickster (prototype, final artwork)
  Nevermore (concept sketch). Please see final artwork in Updates!
  Cursed Roots (concept sketch). Please see final artwork in Updates!
  Carrion, Wayward Son (concept sketch including a curse to test the available space for writing). Please see final artwork in Updates!
  Doombag (concept sketch). Please see final artwork in Updates!
Original Artwork rewards
A comparison of a bookplate (left), the original artwork (right) and a skull and some scissors. A pen, too.
Between the concept sketch and the production prototype, I draw all of the designs at 2X scale. I then scan them and reduce their size, sealing in all the juicy detailed goodness. All Original Artwork rewards will receive the actual full-scale drawings (signed and personalized with your name and a message of your choice), along with a supply of matching bookplates.
Thank you for considering this project!
Sincerely yours, Chris (and my lovely muse Janet). Not pictured: Schnauzers.
...but wait, there's more!
In addition to the previous designs, I will also release the following designs as...
ADD-ONS!
Additional Dapper Decals are available for $2.00 US apiece for all backers at the $12 level and above. Simply "Manage your Pledge" and ADD AN ADDITIONAL $2.00 FOR EACH DECAL to the amount already pledged and I'll add the decals to your order. Please see the stretch goal below for additional details on these sexy vinyl decals.
Squee!
 ...and STRETCH GOALS!
The LOCKED stretch goals are here up top. Scroll below to see all of the goals that have already been unlocked (there are a lot)!
$12,000 pledged: The Gilley van Weirden Guide for Kids Who Can't Write Good And Wanna Learn To Do Other Stuff Good Too
Lern too rite reel güd.
 At $12,000 funding, every backer at the $12 level and above will receive a PDF download of the Gilley van Weirden Guide for Kids Who Can't Write Good And Wanna Learn To Do Other Stuff Good Too.
This guide will contain a handy reference alphabet of my own design, as well as letter variants, stylistic options, ligatures, jots, tittles, flourishes, kerning tips, as well as ample practice space and bookplate-based practice areas so you can perfect the lettering of your name and curses before personalizing the bookplates. Perhaps you can personalize some for a friend or enemy and pass them along as a lovely personalized gift!
As a former design educator and curriculum developer, I'll make sure that the important stuff is included. You just need to practice, especially you Brett.
$15,000 pledged: Home Library Circulation Kit
"Let's play library!" - Me as a kid (full disclosure: last week too).
At $15,000 funding, every backer at the $12 level and above will receive a PDF download of my DIY papercraft Library Circulation Kit!
I've heard it said that the old-fashioned library card is a small time-travel device. Marked as they are with names and dates, one can relive the journey that a book has taken over its life and recall those with whom you've shared its interior riches. As a child I would look at library cards with such interest, wondering who these other people were, or even delighting in the discovery of a friend's signature. Often enough, I'd then add my own name and continue the story of the book's life.
The kit will contain all you need to print your own library cards and card pockets with plenty of space for annotating who borrowed a book and when. The pockets and cards will be decorated with artwork from the bookplate project so everything can match!
With this PDF, some cardstock, a printer, scissors, and a bottle of mucilage (hehe... "mucilaaaaaage") or even a glue stick you'll be able to create an unlimited supply of your own circulation stock. This is the apex of analog book lending management in a digital craft kit!
ALREADY UNLOCKED:
UNLOCKED! $1,000 pledged: Tentacles & Tea Bookplate
Tentacles, tea, and a monocle. #TOLDYOUSO
If funding reaches $1,000.00, every backer will receive 1 Tentacles & Tea bookplate for every 6 bookplates they are eligible for. This breaks down as:
$12 = 2 Tentacles & Tea bookplates 
$22 = 4 Tentacles & Tea bookplates 
$35 = 7 Tentacles & Tea bookplates 
$45 = 11 Tentacles & Tea bookplates 
$55 = 16 Tentacles & Tea bookplates 
$98 = 33 Tentacles & Tea bookplates 
$149 = 4 Tentacles & Tea bookplates
UNLOCKED! $2,000 pledged: Ramble On Bookplate
May the sun shine ever upon you. Please see final artwork in Updates!
If funding reaches $2,000.00, every backer will receive 1 Ramble On bookplate for every 6 bookplates they are eligible for. This breaks down the same as ol' Tentaclepus up there.
This particular design is inspired by those poor, hungry trolls in The Hobbit that were turned to stone by the sun, never getting to enjoy the meal that they worked so hard for. This concept needs a bit of adjusting, but it's pretty much there.
UNLOCKED: $3,000 pledged: Bookmark of Mystery
Your guess at this point is legitimately as good as mine.
If funding reaches $3,000 all backers at the $12.00 tier and above will receive a single Bookmark of Mystery.
Mystery? You betcha! Even I don't know what this will look like, but let's see what the pressure of having to produce something clever forces me to come up with.
UNLOCKED: $4,500 pledged: Dapper Octopus Vinyl Decal
Weird, as promised!
If funding reaches $4,500.00, every backer will receive 1 die-cut Dapper Octopus vinyl decal for every 12 bookplates they are eligible for (rounded up). This breaks down as:
$12 = 1 Dapper Octopus vinyl decal 
$22 = 2 Dapper Octopus vinyl decals 
$34 = 4 Dapper Octopus vinyl decals 
$45 = 6 Dapper Octopus vinyl decals 
$55 = 8 Dapper Octopus vinyl decals 
$98 = 17 Dapper Octopus vinyl decals
$149 = 4 Dapper Octopus vinyl decals
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've managed a successful print-and-ship Kickstarter before, so barring injury or a "victim of his own success" situation, there's nothing too risky about this project. I've set the funding goal high enough to ensure that I can cover the cost of paper, ink, shipping, and everything necessary to produce the labels.

Once funded, I can order the gear and materials and be ready to print when the funding period is over.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Flambeau : the Spirit of Carnival print
updates.update_content: Hi guys!  I hope that the bookplates are proving to be an efficacious deterrent to book theft. I want to let you know that I've just released a new print titled Flambeau.
Good morning -- I'm pleased to announce that the Book Dragon print is now live! Click the image and be magically transported :)

updates.update_userinfo: So long, and thanks for all the fish!
updates.update_content:
I just dropped off the final round of rewards and with exception of only 3 outliers, this concludes the Book Curse bookplate project!
Thanks again for all of the support and for every kind word. I'm fortunate to be small enough that I can make production decisions that profit-driven companies can't make, and when I receive appreciative feedback regarding the quality of my work it provides intangible dividends to both me and the House Elf. As well as providing the funding to make this project a reality, you've also provided plenty of affirmation that we're making the right decisions.

Good morning!
As I sip my coffee, there are only 20 more rewards left to be packed (not counting 3 rewards that can't be shipped as the surveys still haven't been filled out). By the door are the last of the original artwork rewards and a hefty stack of Priority Mail envelopes, ready to be dropped off this afternoon. Another order of ink arrives today and by the end of the week all rewards will be shipped.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATED: Link to the lettering guide
updates.update_content:
Good morning all!
This past Saturday morning, the house elves and I dropped off the $22 tier rewards at the Post Office. Afterwards, we returned home to continue the additional printing and stuffing required for the $35, $45, and $55 reward tiers. I'm happy to report that after a weekend-long reward fulfillment party, these tiers have been stuffed, organized, and are waiting at the door to be dropped off this evening (barring anything unforeseen, natch).

updates.update_userinfo: The Gilley van Weirden Guide for Kids Who Can't Write Good and Wanna Learn To Do Other Stuff Good Too
updates.update_content:
I just dropped off the first round of rewards at the Post Office -- 114 envelopes to be exact! This is roughly 1/3 of the total rewards and the remaining ones are coming together quickly!

In the meantime, I'm wrapping up The Gilley van Weirden Guide for Kids Who Can't Write Good And Wanna Learn To Do Other Stuff Good Too. Once completed, I'll post a link in an update so everybody can download the file from there and so you'll always have the link available in your Kickstarter account should you want to download it again. From a practical standpoint, it also means that I won't have to deal with the privacy issues inherent within a large email blast.

This morning I began stuffing envelopes to determine exactly how each of the tiers will be mailed. It looks like everything will be sent in a #12 envelope except for the Librarian tier which will ship in a rigid flat and the Book Wyrm tier which will ship flat-rate Priority.

campaign.story:
Introducing the perfect organizer for every traveler.
 Hang it. 
Our organizer's innovative design lets you hang your belongings anywhere you want. Plus, this lets you conveniently access all your outfits without struggling or worrying about unfolding your clothes.
             Roll It!
No more space in your luggage? Just roll it and that's it. Now your clothes can fit perfectly in your backpack.      
You're all set.
Ready to start your journey?
   Product Features:
Pack in seconds:  Packing has never been easier. Just roll up your clothes, put them inside. Save a great deal of time and avoid wrinkles.
Well-organized: Our bag has 8 individual compartments that let you easily access every single item. No more wasted time folding your clothes while traveling.
Waterproof: Wet clothes? No more! With our high-quality fabric, your clothes will stay dry and safe all the time. Forget about stains and liquids!
Compact: Need more space inside your luggage? Our design lets you organize and compress your clothes making some extra space.
Lightweight: Our organizer is light as a feather, it only weights 750 grams (26 ounces) and easily holds 1 week of clothing! isn't that cool?
See-through: Our design makes it very simple to locate all pieces of clothes at once . Just grab your favorite outfit and enjoy your day.
Our Story:
While backpacking in Europe in 2016, founder Julian noticed how much of a struggle it was to keep his clothes organized when moving from one city to another. Moreover, it was impossible to take out a single item from the bottom part of his backpack without doing a mess. That is when Hang and Roll was founded.
What is the money for:
We are quite aware that Mexico is a developing economy. For that reason, it is our desire to have a social impact in our local community. With your backing, we will be capable of starting a small workshop and offer sustainable employment to locals in our community, so we can supply the world with our incredible products.
We will forever thank the people that believed in our project. As a free token of our appreciation, we will write on our web-page a complete list of all of our Kickstarter backers.
Our Statement:
Hang and Roll is a brand for all persons with a strong desire to explore the world that wishes to have all their personal items clean and organized at all times. Whether you are a casual weekend-traveler, a passionate backpacker or an outdoors enthusiast, our team’s mission is to create high-quality products that will help you turn all your trips into unforgettable experiences.
Shipping information:
FREE Shipping in Mexico and the U.S. on our products
Products Photos:
        Contact Us:
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/HangandRoll/?fref=ts
Email: contactus@hangandroll.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are quite aware that every project has it risks. To minimize these, we have invested a serious amount of time into our planing. We have precisely calculated our production estimates (For this reasons, we set up limits for our rewards) and look into all factor regarding distribution to our supporters. Additionally, we have a very complete team working with us.
As a result, Hang and Roll can assure to all of our backers in Kickstarter that they will receive their H&Rs rewards by the stipulated time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
DEAR BACKERS
We started in december 2016 with only an idea and you guys supported us and helped bringing that idea to life. Back then we faced some problems concerning production of such a big initial order, worldwide fullfillment and the whole organisation.
In comparison to the first campaign, we now have experience in shipping worldwide, bulk production and know how things work here on Kickstarter.

Hello Amigos, 
Thank you so much for your support and all the positive feedback on our product. We are sorry for the long delay in our project, this was a learning experience for us here in H&R. We did not expect that the project would be so successful and we would get a great deal of orders from overseas.  
The main problem was depending on third parties, and even though we gave everything to fulfill the orders as quickly as possible, organizing an international fulfillment scheme with our distribution partners took time and it was more complex than we through. We were to be honest a little overwhelmed. That said, we are happy to announce that the last few rewards are being sent to their respective owners at this precise moment. These last packages were delayed as we had some problems with our t-shirt supplier, and we did not have all the right t-shirt sizes for our last European Backers. You should be receiving your rewards in the next 1-2 weeks, depending on where you are located. We would like to thank all of you for supporting this project. We wish that the Hang and Roll makes all your trips easier and fun.

updates.update_userinfo: Final Packages are being sent out,
updates.update_content:
Hi Guys, 
Sorry for the long wait. We have been receiving messages from our Backers in Europe asking for a delivery date.
Now, we can give you more concrete answers now regarding shipping to all our European Backers.

updates.update_userinfo: Rewards are being sent to all EU!
updates.update_content:
Amigos, 
We want to announce that our new e-commerce site/ travel blog is online. We want to invite all of you to check out our page. 
www.hangandroll.com
We want to thank all of you again for making this project and the start of our company a reality. We are working really hard every day to deliver great products to all of our backers and travelers out there.

Hello Amigos, 
As mentioned before, we will be uploading our new web page soon. 
There is a special section for you guys, where we mention the names of all the backers that supported us. You guys made this possible, and we would like to post your name as a thank you.

Hi Amigos, we wanted to give a general update on the situation. 
We are very excited to keep receiving positive comments about the product from your side.
We have received several messages from our backers in Europe and Australia regarding where are their rewards?  
The rewards are on the way; they were actually sent off some time ago. They are on the boat right now as we speak, but keep in mind that sea transit from Mexico to Europe/Australia can take around 4 weeks, plus customs procedure and transportation to our warehouse. (This processes can take a little more than usual being that this is the first time).

Hello Travelers,

We are so happy about all the positive comments!
Thank you all very much for the patience and trust these past months. It was a lot of work but everything is coming together in the end.
We hope you love your H&Rs and wear your mystery t-shirts proudly. Take them everywhere you travel!

campaign.story:
The world doesn’t need another shirt. It does need a better shirt. The RS01 is that shirt.
The RS01 was engineered from the ground up to meet your work and active life. It is a shirt built for the transitions. During the day it passes for well-cut office wear. En route, it lights up like a STOP sign. The RS01 was ruthlessly developed through endless prototyping, creative destruction, and fastidious attention to minutiae to wring out the perfect fit, material, and closures for your modern life. The result is an office-formal shirt that works as well in the crouch on your bike as it does at your desk, a shirt with minimal, clean details and an extra-sharp silhouette. It is also a shirt which lights up via 3M retroreflective when on the street. The RS01 is passive*, minimal design at it best. 
*shouts when needed.
    Retroreflective  
While we love smart tech solutions, nothing beats the straightforward simplicity of passive design. No USB cables, battery recharging and malfunctioning electronics - wear the RS01 and be seen. 
We worked with a specialty technical fabric mill to make a custom fabric which has retroreflective woven into the material. Other reflective garments often have reflectivity printed on top, wearing out quickly, cracking, peeling and losing its luster. In the RS01 fabric, the reflectivity is durable and bright. The reflective element is invisibly nestled into the Shepherd's Check pattern. It stays hidden during the day, and pops out on the street. 
Pedestrian Visibility at Night
Active Cut
We did backflips to develop our own pattern made specifically to stretch and twist. We reduced pattern pieces. We rethought sleeve construction. We tried, failed, and refined. The current construction is sleek and novel. It fits like a modern dress shirt and behaves like a second skin. 
Bonded Edges
Keep it tight and flat. We removed pattern pieces, and sharpened the silhouette by bonding instead of sewing key elements of the RS01. The cuffs, collar, and wind block are all super-flush (the anti-Puffy shirt). This innovative construction will keep you looking, literally, sharp. 
Wind Block 
Desperate cyclists stuff newspapers down their shirts to block wind on chilly descents. No more. The RS01 integrates wind blocking panels directly into the shirt construction. We added sueded microfiber panels over the ribs to block just enough wind to keep out the chill. The back, armpits, and sleeves uncovered so you can dump heat as you warm up from the inside. 
Rear Pocket
The cel phone hasn't yet been installed into your brain pan. Until then, easy access is the next best option. We installed a rear pocket into the seam with a snap-closure, so you can snag your cel in an instant. Keep your digital device easily at hand, balanced AND out of harm's way. (Yes, we designed the pocket to fit your 6" phablet) 
Low-Profile Snaps  
Everything about the RS01 is "High Speed, Low Drag". We edited, questioned, tested, and reduced every. little. detail. These snaps are flush to the body, tough as nails, hold well, and fasten quickly and easily.
Drop Tail
Most active transit options involve some degree of crouching, the cut of your garments should fit that posture. Keep your crack covered with a little extra. We've got your back.
      The RS01 is tailored for a sharp, active fit with a modern silhouette. 
Check your measurements and use the guide below to select your size. You don't need to answer when pledging - we'll ask for your size right before we begin shipping.
      You can trust that when you back our project, you will receive your rewards. Together we have launched 4 other successful Kickstarter projects - all delivered. The fabric mill is waiting for our green light to begin producing our custom integrated reflective fabric. Our factory is waiting for the fabric to begin producing our shirt. 
DOMESTIC  
Shipping is included with your pledge level within the United States.
INTERNATIONAL
Please note that international backers may have to pay import duties or fees from your local delivery.

We've done this before - designed, manufactured and shipped our own product and our team has developed literally hundreds of products for other clients.

While there are always the possibility of unforeseen delays, we know communication with our backers is key to a successful project for everyone.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Wired  |  Fast Co. Design  |  Dwell  |  It’s Nice That  |  Office Supply Geek  |  Swiss Miss  | Design Week  |  Quipsologies  |  Mental Floss  |  Notcot  |  Notebook Stories  |  AIGA
—
My name is Aron Fay. During the day, I am a graphic designer at Pentagram Design in New York City. After hours and on weekends, I work on my own independent projects such as this.
—
Five years ago my boss at Pentagram, Michael Bierut, handed me a composition book, and I've been fascinated by these utilitarian and ubiquitous notebooks ever since.
—
Through extensive research, I've learned that, interestingly enough, these notebooks haven't changed all that much since they came into being centuries ago. And that they have an 180+ year history of being produced using the most economical manufacturing methods available.
With all the new advances in the fields of papermaking, printing, and binding since the 1800s, I was interested in what it would be like to create a notebook that uses the new printing and binding technologies and the highest quality materials possible, while still maintaining the nostalgic pattern that we all know and love. 
—
That's how 'comp' was born. An elegant, sophisticated, and long-lasting version of the classic composition notebook.
comp uses today's finest available processes, materials, and design
Front cover with custom drawn pattern and redesigned offset label
Layflat binding opens completely flat to reveal ultra white, smooth 120 gsm uncoated paper
Detail of book spine made with beautiful Italian Cialux cloth and thick, durable 'boards on' covers
Lined version features optimized 3/8" ruling and black interior feint lines
The interior of the unlined version of the notebook
Color-through dyed black endsheets
—
"When you look at [comp], immediately it’s recognizable. It reminds us of something that all of us have seen all our lives. And yet, it’s taken all the characteristics of that object and made them the best they can be." —Michael Bierut, Partner, Pentagram
—
The history
comp first started as a curiosity, then turned into a research project, and finally, (admittedly) into a bit of an obsession. I've spoken with many experts in fields such as paper marbling, book binding and design, have visited rare book libraries, and poured through many stationery catalogs trying to document the history of the composition notebook. 
Bookbinder, Paul Vogel. Photo: Brian Kelley
The pattern on the composition notebook was an industrialized version of the traditional art of marbling, a process that was used to make decorative papers for book coverings and end papers. Paper marbling began thousands of years ago––in the tenth century in China and later in Japan during the twelfth century.
Ebru pattern. Image: Terry Underwood Evans/Shutterstock.
The marbling process remains more or less the same today: It essentially involves dropping different colored pigments into a bath of water (typically with size added), and working them into a unique pattern with different instruments and brushes. Once you have the desired pattern, a piece of paper is rested on top and absorbs the pattern to create a marbled paper. Meanwhile, in the fifteenth century in Turkey, a different type of marbling was being developed called Ebru, which eventually made its way to Europe.
Example of a pseudo-marbled agate pattern
Around the early nineteenth century (1820s–1830s), a new industrialized type of paper marbling began in France and Germany. This 'pseudo-marbling' process, a term coined by marbling expert Richard J. Wolfe, aimed to create marbled patterns using industrial processes––it was here that a new type of pattern was created in Germany, called the 'agate' pattern. Over time, these chemically made agate papers started to be used on more and more cheap blank notebooks, and the pattern evolved slightly into the printed composition notebook pattern we know and love today. 
—
The evolution
Pseudo-marbled French composition notebook from 1860. Image courtesy of Alwen Rambo/Belle Brocante
Pseudo-marbled French composition notebook from 1887. Image courtesy of Alwen Rambo/Belle Brocante
Pseudo-marbled French composition notebook from 1901. Image courtesy of Alwen Rambo/Belle Brocante
Printed American composition notebook, 1964
Printed composition notebook, 2016, Pennsylvania, USA
—
A cultural icon
Throughout the years, the composition notebook has become a sort of cultural icon. Its unique design has been imitated, reproduced, shared, and worshiped; making a name for itself inside the art and design community and beyond. Strangely there’s no one producer of these notebooks since the pattern is not copyrighted and exists in many unique variations.
Over the years, the composition notebook's black and white marbled pattern has inspired and been used by famous artists, writers, and designers, like Jean-Michel Basquiat, Ettorre Sottsaas Jr., Roy Lichtenstein, and Michael Bierut.  
—
Why recreate the composition notebook?
Composition notebooks, as they are now, have become an important piece of American culture. That said, they fall into a category of objects created for utility, that focus less on longevity and more on economy.
As a graphic designer, printmaker, and bookbinder I wanted to create a notebook that uses today's finest available processes, materials, and design to create something that will be kept, cherished, and used for years to come. 
—
Features
Here is a more detailed look into comp's features.
An exposed spine using the best quality Italian cialux cloth, instead of tape for added durability. 
Covers that are made of thick wrapped boards for added durability and rigidity. The cover shown left is a traditonal notebook cover. The cover shown at right is comp's thicker covers.
Layflat binding allows the notebook to open completely flat, which makes for easier use. 
Italian micro-embossed cover paper, which is durable and feels much more premium than a traditional notebook cover. 
 Color dyed black end sheets for clean inside and outside back covers.
A beautiful, unique, custom marbled cover pattern, optimized to balance light and dark perfectly, with every shape in the pattern individually placed for a unified look throughout. 
A redesigned offset label that balances perfectly with the black binding at the left edge and allows you to write your name or other information you choose on the front cover. 
Ultra white interior paper that is substantially thicker than a traditional composition notebook, allowing for less show through back to back between pages. These uncoated sheets work exceptionally well with all sorts of pens and pencils.
Both unlined as well as lined versions of the notebook. The lined version utilizes 3/8” ruling in which the length of the lines have been optimized for the best writing experience. Thin black lines are also used instead of traditional blue lines for a more streamlined look.
The lined version also has unique header ruling that help provide hierarchy as well as a clear way to track page to page.
—
Technical specifications
7.5" x 9.75" upright
148 pages (74 leaves)
Custom designed pattern
Offset printed covers (with double hit of black ink for extra contrast)
2mm wrapped hardcovers wrapped with fine micro-embossed cover paper
Boards on, layflat binding
Square back with sewn and glued signatures 
120 gsm ultra white, smooth, uncoated interior paper 155 whiteness (CIE), 96% opacity, 122 brightness (ISO 2470/D65 %), 150 Roughness (Bendtsen, ml/min)
Color-through dyed black endsheets
Square corners
Black Italian cialux cloth
Lined version printed offset with stochastic screening for fine reproduction of feint lines
All materials used are FSC certified
Printed and bound in Italy
Rewards
—
One book
Lined or unlined
$19
—
Three books
All lined or all unlined
Plus free tote bag
$57
—
Ten books 
All lined or all unlined 
Plus free tote bag 
$170
Why Kickstarter? 
Since the composition notebook is such a ubiquitous object and has been used by so many different people in so many different communities, I thought Kickstarter would be a perfect place to bring comp to life and share it with as many people as possible.
With your help, I'll be able to pay for the manufacturing and shipping of comp, along with compensating all the different components that have helped bring this project to life.
The Kickstarter goal includes every single cost involved in making this project happen:
LLC creation
Legal fees
Printing
Binding
Tote bag manufacturing 
Label manufacturing
Shipping the books to the US fulfillment house
Packaging
Prototyping
Media Licensing
Photography
Video
Music
Campaign management
Kickstarter fees
Payment processing fees
—
Project Credits
Created by
Aron Fay
aronfay.com
Campaign Management 
Vann Alexandra 
vannalexandra.com
Film
Brandon Kuzma 
kuzmafilms.com
Music
Edo Van Breemen
edovan.com
Product Photography 
Brian Kelley
briankelley.nyc
Special thanks to Michael Bierut, Caroline Weaver, Paul Vogel, Richard J. Wolfe, Sid Berger, Chela Metzger, Hamish Smyth, Jesse Reed, Britt Cobb, Meg Miller and to the countless others who have helped with along the way.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
comp has already been fully designed and we've gone through several rounds of protoyping. Our prototypes use the exact materials and printing methods that will be used for our larger production run if our campaign is funded.

The biggest risk lies in the production of the books. However, since we have produced several rounds of prototypes (as well as many books and notebooks in the past) we feel confident that we will be able to offer this book at the highest quality possible. 

We will be a part of every single part of the process: working closely with our binding, printing, and fulfillment partners; reviewing additional proofs of the book; being on press at the printing plant; and checking the binding of these books.

We have also produced prototypes of our tote bag, using actual materials and printing processes. Again, we feel confident in the prototypes we have done to date and will work closely with our tote bag manufacturer and label maker to bring these products to life.

Since these books and tote bags are high production objects, they take time to print, bind, finish, sew etc. We plan on updating backers regularly with each step of the process.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Miss out on backing Fidget Cube?
  What is Fidget Cube?
Fidget Cube is a desk toy for anyone who likes to fidget.
        30 seconds of your time could make the difference in growing the Fidget Cube community. Hit one of the buttons below and tag a friend or coworker who can't stop fidgeting!
        How do I use it?
It's simple. Fidget Cube (patent pending) has six sides. Each side features something to fidget with:
              Fidgeting that matches your style.
Fidget Cube is available in 10 different color schemes:
Dice, Graphite, Midnight, Aqua, Sunset, Berry, Fresh, Retro, Kickstarter Edition, and Backer Designed (design voted on by the Fidget Family!).
            Why fidget?
We love this question. It's not uncommon to hear fidgeting being spoken about negatively. It's often labeled as unprofessional and deemed as anti-intellectual behavior.
But in reality, the exact opposite has been suggested to be the case. Below are just some of many resources highlighting the work that's being done to learn more about this behavior:
The Science Of Why We Fidget While We Work
Squirm With Purpose
Stress Toys: Mindlessness With A Purpose?
The Benefits Of Fidgeting For Students With ADHD
Why Do We Fidget?
Using Stress Balls To Focus The Attention Of Students
We believe that the way we look at fidgeting needs to change.
This behavior isn't one that should continue to be stigmatized and mocked as unbecoming or inappropriate. We are passionate about the idea that fidgeting is a process that, with the right tools and outlet, can have positive and real-life applications.
  Where can I use Fidget Cube?
  It was incredibly important to us that the design of Fidget Cube was one that would look great on any desk, whether that desk belonged to a student or a CEO.
There are really no limits to when and where you can use Fidget Cube. Use it while listening to a lecture, or while studying for that upcoming test. Use it in the next meeting you have to attend (or lead). Use it at your desk while working on projects. Enduring a lengthy commute and need to relieve some stress? Fidget away. Marathoning a Netflix series? Yep, you can fidget then too.
  But I already have a pen. Do I really need Fidget Cube?
Pens (and the wonderful clicking they do) were a huge inspiration in the design process of Fidget Cube. They are probably one of the most commonly used fidget "tools". We like to see Fidget Cube as more of a fidget "toolbox". You don't have to be constrained to simple clicking, you can pick your poison based on your mood. Yes... We are very serious about our fidgeting.
  I don't really fidget. Would I enjoy Fidget Cube?
We think so! Not everyone fidgets the same amount. But spending the last few years deeply interested in the process of fidgeting, we've observed the fact that almost everyone fidgets to some extent, in a variety of ways.
Maybe you're not the type of person who uses objects like paper clips or pencils to fidget with. If that's the case, it's very likely you fidget in some other way, such as bouncing your knee up and down, tapping your foot, or picking at lint in your pocket.
We believe that Fidget Cube provides a tangible way to capture your floating attention, regardless of whether you fidget consciously or subconsciously.
  Rewards.
For believing in our vision, we want to thank you! Check out our rewards below:
    Stretch Goals.
         The Team.
  We're Antsy Labs, and more specifically, Matthew and Mark McLachlan - brothers that have a passion for designing solutions to problems we come across in daily life.
Where are you in the process?
After handfuls of prototypes, we've tweaked every last detail to arrive at the Fidget Cube you see today. We've got a number of working units, but in order to make enough for you to have one as well, we need to place a substantial minimum order for the first production run of Fidget Cube. That's why we're offering Fidget Cube to this awesome community before anyone else.
What does your timeline look like?
Fidget Cube has been an idea we've been dying to bring to fruition since it was first conceived in 2012. The product you're seeing in this project is the result of innumerable hours of iterating and reiterating. We're perfectionists, and we wanted to make sure we got this one right.
Below, you'll see a brief outline of the journey we're on with Fidget Cube, starting from the first discussion about it to when all of you joined the story (and where we go from here)!
We are insanely excited to get Fidget Cube into your hands. So you can be sure that we're going to continue to work day and night until the very last Fidget Cube has shipped.
  Help Out By Sharing Fidget Cube With Your Friends! (#fidgetfever)
Like what you're seeing? Great! Don't be shy about sharing Fidget Cube with your friends. We've made it super easy. Just hit one of the buttons below (or at the top of the page).
The more people who know about Fidget Cube, the larger our community will become! And the larger the community, the better we'll be able to make Fidget Cube!
We can't do this without you!
        Questions?
Ask away! Shoot us a message or post a comment and we'll do our best to get back to you with an answer.
Feedback?
Got a creative idea you think we should implement with Fidget Cube? Don't hesitate - let us know! Fidget Cube is being made possible by you, and we want you to be a part of the creative process as well.
International Backers
This project isn't just for backers in the United States. We'll be shipping Fidget Cube worldwide!
That being said, there are unique processes that apply specifically to international backers that we'd like you to be aware of. Please note that there is no way for us to charge any additional amount on our end for any applicable VAT/duties that may be a result of a specific country's local tax code. Therefore, these fees may be incurred upon receipt of your reward. These fees are the responsibility of each backer, and additional information regarding VAT/duties can be found in our FAQ below.
In addition, due to first class shipping fees and the dimensions of Fidget Cube, shipping rates may seem a bit high for some international locations. We calculated shipping rates beforehand, and are able to swallow some of the shipping costs on orders of 1 or 2 Fidget Cubes. Please note that shipping becomes completely free when you pledge for 5 or more Fidget Cubes.
Some Final Thoughts.
While we strongly believe in the many benefits of fidgeting, we aren't claiming to cure any illness or condition. Fidget Cube is a fun, unique way to customize your fidgeting. When designing Fidget Cube we were inspired by research that claims fidgeting might actually help individuals focus their attention. We have personally found that it helps us stay focused in boring meetings and while working on projects.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This isn't our first rodeo. We've brought several Kickstarter projects to life in the past, and have learned from our experiences. While we have been relentlessly concerned with the details throughout designing, prototyping, and planning for production, there is always the chance that pesky Murphy guy may make an entrance with that law of his.

In the event that things don't go as planned, whether it's a delay in the manufacturing timeline, shipping date, or something else, we promise to communicate honestly with you and work around the clock until we correct the issue.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Fidget Family!
When we launched the crazy idea of Fidget Cube to the world in August of last year, we had no idea what the following days would hold. This has truly been an insane journey, and we want to thank you again for all your support and patience with us.
We wanted to touch base with you again today for a brief and exciting update.

campaign.story:
Hi Kickstarter! Almost 6 years ago, we launched the Glif, a tripod mount for the iPhone 4, on Kickstarter. The response to our campaign was incredible, and it allowed us to build our company, Studio Neat. Since then, we have released several updates to the Glif, but we are back where we started, on Kickstarter, to launch the best version yet.
      (Note: The Glif shown in all images and videos is a 3D printed prototype. The final production Glif will be a much nicer and smoother finish.)
The landscape for smartphone photography has changed dramatically since we launched the original Glif in 2010. With each successive smartphone, the camera is getting more and more incredible. The smartphone has become a legitimate tool, for photographers, filmmakers, and mobile journalists. So our goal is simple: to create the best tripod mount for smartphones, period. To do that, we are focusing on three areas.
1: An innovative quick release mechanism.
Current tripod mounts on the market today fall into one of two categories: screw, or spring. Screw mounts work like a vise; they allow for a secure grip, but are slow and cumbersome to operate every time you want to take your phone in and out of it. Conversely, spring mounts are quick to load and unload, but they have a flimsy grip and are not secure at all. We wanted to create a mount that is the best of both.
The solution we came up with took several rounds of iteration and engineering. The quick release lever, when opened, allows the jaws to move freely, making it easy to quickly load or remove your device. Here is the clever bit: when you close the lever, it automatically tightens around your device, resulting in a super secure connection. It's quick, and secure.
  Cross section of the tightening mechanism.
2: Portrait and Landscape 
Very few tripod mounts on the market today can support a device in both portrait and landscape orientations. With things like panoramic photos, Periscope streams, and Snapchat, smartphones have legitimized the once-smirked-at portrait orientation. The Glif has a side mounted tripod mount, which allows devices to be mounted directly in portrait orientation. 
And speaking of that side mounted tripod mount...
3: Extendability
We want you to consider the Glif as the starting point, the base, of your mobile photography rig. We want it to be a flexible tool that caters to your needs. As such, the Glif has a total of 3 tripod mounts, one on the bottom, one on the side, and one on the top. These allow you to add additional accessories, like a microphone or light.
  Speaking of accessories... we are introducing two!
Hand Grip
Not every situation calls for mounting your smartphone on a stationary tripod, and the hand grip provides a much more comfortable way to shoot freehand, especially if you have additional accessories attached. The hand grip is lovely, milled from solid cherry hardwood. It has an additional tripod thread on the bottom as well.
Wrist Strap
A wrist strap is crucial for that added bit of security when you are shooting freehand. Dan used a prototype when he went zip-lining in the jungles of Jamaica and it worked great. Attach the wrist strap to the bottom of the hand grip, or just attach it directly to the Glif, as a way to add a bit of security and comfort. It is made from durable paracord and leather. The Glif, hand grip, and wrist strap are all tough, robust, and built to last.
What Devices Can the Glif Hold?
The Glif can hold devices roughly in width from 58 mm to 99 mm. This is essentially the range of a naked iPhone SE to an iPhone 6 Plus with a really thick case on it. In all likelihood, your device will fit. 
Design Process
We have been working on and improving the Glif as a product for the past 6 years, and have been working on this version for the last several months. Through countless iterations, we are super happy with the design, and think you will love it too! 
Some of the many prototypes we made.
Why We're on Kickstarter
As usual with these types of products, there is a considerable upfront investment needed to create the multiple molds for injection molding. We have spoken with and received quotes from our manufacturer here in the US, and they are ready to start production if this campaign is a success. As with all of our other Kickstarter campaigns, we want to take you along on the journey of bringing a product into existence. We will be posting numerous update videos, which will document the manufacturing process, and we will be discussing everything in depth on our podcast, Thoroughly Considered.
We hope you will join us in this campaign to create the best tripod mount ever. We can't do it without your help, so please, hit the green button on the right to become a backer and help bring this into reality.
Thanks and have a great day!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
To date, we have successfully funded and fulfilled 5 (!) Kickstarter projects. Each has brought their own challenges and obstacles, and we foresee the same for this one. We hope our track record proves we are capable of overcoming these inevitable challenges in order to bring the new Glif to market. Our manufacturer here in the US (in South Dakota) is already lined up and ready to go, and we have worked with them many times in the past, so we are confident moving forward if this project is funded.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Greetings Backers,
Just wanted to give a brief update on shipping. Every Glif and Full Set for Kickstarter backers has been manufactured. If you are in the US, they have been shipped to you, and most if not all of you should have received them by now (unless you were late filling out the survey, in which case it will be on the way soon). For international backers, inventory is already on the way to our UK warehouse (it was shipped on Monday), once it arrives and processes in the warehouse, your order will ship and you’ll receive a shipping confirmation email. Inventory is also on the way to our US warehouse, which will handle nearby international backers, like Canada. Thanks everyone for your patience!

Greetings Backers, we have a quick update for you.
First: Folks have started to receive their Glifs! Let us know what you think on Twitter or Instagram, @studioneat on both.
Second: We just sent out emails with tracking info for all of the US backers. Unfortunately, we have to send these emails all at once, even if your Glif hasn’t shipped yet. So, although the tracking link you receive will work, it might not show progress for a few days, depending on when your Glif ships. Just the nature of how our temporary fulfillment situation is set up. Sorry for any confusion!

Greetings Backers!
At last, Glifs have started to go out the door to backers! We are about a week behind schedule, for a few reasons. First, the material took longer than we expected to dry. If there is moisture in the material (like from humidity), it can cause blemishes in the final part. To guard against this, material is put in a dryer and typically only takes a few hours to dry, but our material ended up taking a couple days due to its unusual composition. On top of that, while the levers were being molded one of the parts didn’t eject, and as the mold closed it bent a pin, which needed to be repaired. Fun times! But the good news is everything is now running smoothly and we are in full production mode.

Greetings backers!
Just wanted to send a quick note to let you all know that as of 11:00 AM this morning, production has (finally) started! Our manufacturers are molding the levers and two body pieces first, then will overmold the soft pads on the bodies, assemble all of the pieces, and then package everything up to be shipped out. They have already pre-folded all the boxes, and kitted all of the other parts for the full sets (the hand grip and wrist strap), to save some time on the last step. They are estimating that orders will begin to ship to backers on Tuesday or Wednesday next week, and they estimate being able to ship about 500 orders a day. Which means getting all of the domestic orders shipped should take a little over a week. International orders are going to be shipped first to our warehouse in the UK, and from there they will be shipped to backers. So those will take a couple more weeks, but hopefully not too much of a delay.

Greetings patient backers!
Just wanted to give a quick update of where we are at. We have finally solved the cosmetic issue that has been plaguing us the past few weeks! Just a matter of adjusting some levels, and tweaking how the dye is mixed, and we are now good to go. Whew!
We are also making a slight mold modification to change the “snappiness” of how the lever feels when opening and closing. The good news is, this modification will only take 1 or 2 days, and it will occur in this lull while we are waiting for the material to arrive, so no time will actually be lost in making the change.

Greetings backers!
We are still working through the cosmetic issues mentioned in the last update, but are getting very close to having it licked. In the meantime, we wanted to show you folks a little video of the functioning production sample, in action. Check it out below!

Greetings Backers!
We know many of you have been waiting patiently for a project update, but we wanted to make sure we had solid information to share before blasting everyone’s inbox. Things have been taking longer than expected getting the mold modified and calibrated, but that is all taken care of now. 
So first, the good news: we have finalized the material! You may remember from the last update we were waiting on one last material to try so we could make a final decision. This material look quite a bit longer to arrive and get molded, but we are happy to say the wait was worth it because it performs exactly as we hoped. For a bit of detail to those who care, the material is PC (Polycarbonate) with PTFE (Teflon) as an additive. What this gets us is a material that is durable and very resistant to wear over time, which is important when you are snapping and unsnapping the quick release lever hundreds of times over the life of the Glif. This thing is built to last.

Greetings Backers!
Hope everyone had a wonderful holiday break. We wanted to pop in to give a brief update on where things stand with the Glif.
Mold modification. As stated in the previous update, we decided to make a slight modification to the mold, which was slated to take about 4 weeks. This is on schedule, and we should be getting the modified mold back and tested in a week or so. For those curious, the modification has to do with the "feet" of the Glif, and where the rubbery bit is overmolded. We wanted to create more space so that the rubber had more room to compress, and this required a modification to the mold. Anyhow, this was an easy (albeit time consuming) change, so we don't foresee any problems.

Greetings Backers!
Well, it wouldn't be a Kickstarter project without a delay at the 11th hour! Last we spoke, things were looking good, we were happy with the production samples we had seen. Upon further investigation though, we caught some problems that need to be addressed. Namely, we think the materials are not quite right (not durable enough on the lever, or soft enough on the pads), and we are testing alternatives. Also, we decided we need to make a slight modification to the mold, which is estimated to take 4 weeks.

And if you have any problems with the survey, simply reply directly to it from your inbox.

campaign.story:
The Titanium Ti-CAP!
What is the Al-Cap?
The Al-Cap is the world's strongest and most universal bottle cap that makes any standard sized water or soda bottle simple to carry and easy to reuse. Its unique thread design allows the cap to fit standard sized water and soda bottles including Dasani, Aquafina, Smart Water,  and the list goes on and on! Once we reach our stretch goal of $2000, you can choose from a wide list of anodizing colors. You can also get your Al-Cap in gun-metal gray. 
The Al-Cap fits all these bottles and more!
    The Al-Cap threads are so strong, you can hang from your bottle
Choosing the Right Al-Cap
While the Al-Cap fits all standard-sized bottles, we couldn't ignore the fact that many water bottles sold have non-standard threads. These threads are shorter and smaller like in the picture bellow on the right. You may recognize this short-mouthed bottle. This bottle can be found just about anywhere water bottles are purchased in bulk. We designed a second version of the Al-Cap to fit these the non-standard threads. We call it the Al-Cap B. If you drink from bottles with threads like the bottle pictured on the right, you need an Al-Cap B. If you find yourself drinking from bottles with threads like the bottle pictured on the left, you need an Al-Cap A. 
You don't need to worry about picking which cap and which color right now. At the end of our campaign we'll send you a survey to find out which caps you would like (A or B) and which color you would like. 
Al-Cap A on the left, Al-Cap B on the right
The Al-Cap Design
The Al-Cap is CNC machined from aerospace aluminum to be lightweight but strong. Designed with soft rolling edges, it can click onto your keychain and be carried comfortably in your pocket.  Each cap is fitted with a high quality, food grade o-ring to ensure a perfect seal even when lightly snug. 
The Titanium Ti-Cap
Did we mention they seal well? 
No camera tricks here. An Al-Cap supporting the pressure of a Dodge diesel truck!
***A note about which bottles the Al-Cap fits 
The Al-Cap has been designed with and tested on standard sized bottles found here in the US. The Al-Cap does not fit all bottle caps, just the majority.
campaign.risks:

While we own and operate the facility that produces the Al-Cap,the possibility exists that orders from our campaign might exceed the capacity of our machinery. 

But don't worry. We're prepared to invest in the equipment necessary to deliver the Al-Cap to our backers on-time!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
"Received my x-blade today. The tool feels real good in my hand and fits perfect on my key ring. Great tool looking forward to your next project." - G.Carozza
"Got my knife, and it's pretty damn sweet!" - L. O'Neill
"Got my X-blades today and I've already used them. Like the feel and the portability of them and I seem to have more control." - Grumpy
"I just got mine today and I really love it." - B. Lawrence
I launched the original X-Blade Pocket campaign on Kickstarter back in February with a wonderful response that got completely funded in under 2 hours! The campaign had 744 backers and although everyone was very excited about the product I received many requests for a larger version. Well, I took the suggestions seriously and started designing the new versions immediately!
I am proud to introduce the new X-Blade RUGGED & X-Blade EXECUTIVE!
  PLAY

                          I spent months designing, prototyping and re-designing the original X-Blade POCKET until I was satisfied with the design. It has a highly effective collet and drawbar enabling the blades to be easily and rapidly replaceable. After the success of the X-Blade POCKET from the first campaign I used the same mechanism approach but extended the main body for an easier grip. I couldn't decide if I wanted to make the new longer version in a fancy, luxurious style or a more rugged style so I decided to do both!  The X-Blade EXECUTIVE has a smooth, contoured exterior giving it a really expensive feel and it's topped off with a polished pocket clip. For the X-Blade RUGGED I went with a more industrial look with extra knurling, extra tread lines and extra fine details in all areas such as the giant hex endcap. These finished pieces feel far superior than any craft blade handles that I have ever felt! I'm confident that you'll love 'em!
  Get Your Project Funded Today!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Life is full of risks but backing a Kickstarter campaign shouldn't be one of them! For my last campaign I had no experience launching a Kickstarter campaign so I enlisted the help of my good friend, Avi Goldstein who has a company that has run many successful Kickstarter campaigns. I performed the day to day campaign work but used Avi's help with the campaign set-up and logistics to get all rewards fulfilled as he has extensive experience in this area as you can see by all the positive feedback left on all of his projects! https://www.kickstarter.com/profile/34951038

Our first campaign went off without a hitch and the rewards were shipped out exactly when promised with the positive comments about the product quality still pouring in!

I am using the same machine shop for these X-Blade versions as well and expect no less than the same quality of workmanship and commitment to on-time fulfillment as with our previous campaign.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

UnGRIDDED collection
    **WE ADDED ANOTHER NEW BOOK** 
UnGRIDDED SKULLS filled with 100 skulls. More details in the update.
Made in collaboration with Fire and Bone
AVAILABLE IN THE REWARDS ( or add $25 to pledge) >>>>>>
  **WE ADDED A NEW BOOK** UnGRIDDED CITIES filled with 100 urban plans from around the world. More details in the update.
AVAILABLE IN THE REWARDS ( or add $25 to pledge) >>>>>>
Breaking the Grid of Coloring books and Notebooks
Whether you are coloring, taking notes, planning, journaling or just drawing... a notebook is a major aspect of the day. This simple tool can format your creations, organize your thoughts, set your goals, relieve stress, etc... all while on-the-go to your next adventure.
The UnGRIDDED collection is a series of large coloring books and pocket-sized notebooks focusing on different topics from many diverse disciplines.
Each page is patterned with unique linework from artist/designers AMINIMAL Studio, Nervous system, and HYBYCOZO. And focuses on the topics of Travel, Urban Planning, Natural systems, Mathematics, Sacred Geometry, Music, Generative art and more...
Fill the pages with your own art.
UnGRIDDED Coloringbook (8.5" x 8.5")
  UnGRIDDED notebooks Series I (3.5" x 5")
  COLORING BOOK
To inspire art and creativity 
The First book in the collection is the UnGRIDDED Coloringbook. 
A Large 8.5"x8.5" format book features 100 artforms, highly detailed to inspire your creativity.
Designed by A M I N I M A L studio, The artforms are intricate 3D Geometry translated into 2D Artworks. We were inspired by the works of Ernst Haeckel, Diatoms, Mandalas, Japanese Temari balls, and more...
 Each form is unique with varying degrees of intricacy.
  One point of our studio's philosophy is: Complexity is Simple. By coloring the artforms, you will comprehend its mathematical structures and be inspired. We look forward to see what you create. #UnGRIDDED
NOTEBOOKS
For on-the-go
  Take a notebook with you on your adventures into the city or into nature. Become inspired to write about your journeys. Draw new patterns when you are thinking of new ways to create. or color in the patterns to relax into a new art. There is a notebook for each individual's interests.
32 pages are individually and uniquely patterned with a specific concept. Series I consist of Prototype, landscapes, and cities. Series II consist of nature, wonder, and music and are designed in collaboration with designers and artist, Nervous System (nature) and Hybocozo (wonder). 
SERIES I
The first series in the collection consists of three books.
001 - Prototype
Filled with the initial (coloringbook) patterns that initiated the ideas for the series of books
002 - Landscape
Filled with topographical maps of National Parks and Landforms
003 - Cities
Filled with Street maps of different cities around the world
SERIES II - ARTIST COLLABORATIONS
As a way to connect artist and highlight their design philosophies, Series II artworks are formatted into the notebooks. additional funding goes towards creation of new books
NATURE - in collaboration with NERVOUS SYSTEM
Filled with the generative artworks found in cellular natural systems
WONDER - in collaboration with HYBYCOZO 
Filled with artworks to discover sacred patterns
MUSIC - Theory of Sound by Ernst Chladni
Filled with Ernst Chladni's experiments of natural frequencies patterns
SERIES III?...
With stretchgoals, we can create more series and books.
  ART PRINTS
Limited Edition Giclee Artprints are available for Kickstarter rewards.
REWARDS
                        FUNDING
The funding goes towards the creation of the books.
The artist receive royalties on every copy sold.
We hope to create as many series as we can that follow similar themes and collaborating with many more artist. Additional funding goes towards creation of new books and artwork.
TIMELINE 
  STRECHGOALS
By funding this project, new ideas and rewards will emerge from the collection. As well as a continuation of series.

campaign.story:
Hello, there. We're the team behind Digital Abstracts, online magazine about art, design, products and trends.
We have always been inspired by the outstanding works of illustrators and designers featured on our resource, so we came up with an idea to mix their differences in a single project.
The project
The idea of the project is to create a unique deck of poker playing cards where each card is individually designed by a different international artist.
The project is called Playing Arts and each year we invite 55 designers and illustrators from all over the world to collaborate with us. Their particular styles and techniques convert a simple deck of cards in eclectic pocket-sized art gallery that can be shuffled and played.
We've already released two awesome decks: Edition One and Edition Two.
Сards from Edition Two deck
  __
This year we are releasing two new decks at once and turning the project into the global design event
Both decks will have the same concept (one deck = 55 artists), but slightly different approach:
1. Edition Three: we've carefully selected and invited awesome designers and illustrators to create the artworks for this deck.
2. Special Edition: we've launched an international design contest and we invite you to join the jury team and help us to define 55 outstanding works that will form this deck.
__
1. Edition Three deck
Edition Three deck
To design cards for this deck we've carefully selected and invited 55 designers and illustrators from 27 different countries. Joshua Davis, Justin Maller, Mike Perry, Alessandro Pautasso, Bradley GMUNK Munkowitz and Jonny Wan are just a handful of the artists involved.
Introducing first cards:
First cards from Edition Three deck
10 of Spades by Bratislav Milenkovic (Serbia)
Jack of Spades by Grzegorz Domaradzki (Poland)
7 of Diamonds by Rafael Mayani (Mexico)
"I was looking to find the way to make a fun twist on 10 spades card, by incorporating the original element (ten spades) into the artwork – so I thought of having a fun looking guy with spades for his braces." — Bratislav Milenkovic
_
First cards from Edition Three deck
  4 of Clubs by Victor Vergara (Colombia)
King of Hearts by Denis Zilber (Israel)
2 of Clubs by Riccardo Guasco (Italy)
"I wanted to do an homage to the Cezanne’s painting "The Card Players 1894–1895", one of the works that started the idea of Cubism in art history." — Riccardo Guasco
_
First cards from Edition Three deck
  Backside by Juan Díaz-Faes (Spain)
Ace of Clubs by Omaraqil (Pakistan)
5 of Hearts by Bram Vanhaeren (Belgium)
"In a previous personal project I have been looking into a way to make letters sexy again. Why not apply this to numbers as well. The idea is to mislead the viewer into seeing a regular number, but at a second glare notice an appealing woman looking at the person. Maybe her look succeeds in getting the person attention and distract the player into a new dimension." — Bram Vanhaeren
__
And more cards showed up:
          __
Each day you will find a new card and a small interview with the author on the project’s website and once a week we will post an update here on Kickstarter.
Follow the project on Twitter, Facebook and Instagram to be the first to see new cards when they show up!
"Take care of your ability to observe and wonder, so you can admire the world and its beauty. There is so much more to discover, so much more to learn and there are many details that delight." — Victor Vergara
__
2. Special Edition deck
Special Edition deck
We've launched an international design contest that will give a chance to artists from all over the world to show off their skills and share their vision of the particular playing card. 55 best artworks will form this Special Edition deck.
More than 550 artists entered this contest and have already started working on their cards. At the end of this Kickstarter campaign all artworks will be showcased on Playing Arts website opened for voting. Most voted and carefully selected artworks will pass to the next round where a panel of judges made up of Playing Arts staff and YOU, Kickstarter backers, will choose the winners of the contest.
Victor Vergara is working on his 4 of Clubs card for Edition Three deck
Day to day we will reveal sketches, "work in process" shots and some early cards in our social networks and through weekly Kickstarter updates. You can also track the progress following #PlayingArtsContest hashtag in Twitter, Facebook and Instagram.
See some of the first submissions for the contest in our latest update!
By choosing reward that includes Special Edition deck, you will get the pack of this beautiful cards and also join the jury team and help us to select 55 outstanding works that will form this deck.
__
Features
Each deck will include 52 illustrated custom playing cards and jokers plus an info card that reveals the names of all the designers and illustrators who have contributed to corresponding edition.
The decks will be beautifully and professionally printed in USA by the US Playing Card Company on legendary Bicycle® paper, the highest quality playing card stock available. Cards will be coated with the Air Cushion Finish for the smoothest feel.
__
To bring this two new decks to life we need your support
Your support is our motivation to move forward and turn our ideas into reality. Get personally involved in the creative process by selecting your reward.
We would also really appreciate if you can help us spread the word and share Playing Arts project for everyone to enjoy. We value each and every single tweet, Facebook post and Instagram shot.
Since we launched in 2012, we've received countless support from our friends, partners, customers, backers, media resources, card- and design community members.
Thank you!
__
Add-ons
You can add additional products to your pledge. The details:
      To include this add-ons, simply add corresponding price to your pledge. We will send out a survey at the end of the campaign to find out exactly what you want your pledged money to go towards.
__
Timeline
8 May — 26 June: The contestants are working on their cards. Meanwhile, the project is live on Kickstarter.
27 June — Mid July*: Public voting. All entries will be showcased on Playing Arts website opened for voting. Most voted and carefully selected artworks will pass to the next round.
Mid July — End July*: Judging. A panel of judges made up of Playing Arts staff and YOU, Kickstarter backers, will choose the winners of the contest.
August*: Announcement of the winners.
August — November*: Printing the cards.
November*: Shipping rewards to US backers.
January**: Shipping rewards to backers from the rest of the world.
* Exact dates to be confirmed and updated, stay tuned.
** Rewards to Non-US backers can be shipped earlier (see "Shipping" section below).
__
Shipping
Since the cards will be printed in USA, rewards to US backers will be shipped via our partners from Texas right after the cards being printed.
The rewards for backers from the rest of the world will be shipped from Europe a bit later (see "Timeline" section above).
NON-US BACKERS: Please add €9 to your pledge if you want your reward to be shipped from USA in November (optional).
__
Press about the project
For the last couple of years Playing Arts project was featured in 100+ blogs and magazines, from Esquire to Advanced Photoshop, both online and print.
  “The talented artists involved were invited to create the world’s most unique deck of playing cards. The end result is an amazing beautiful, eclectic and unique collector’s cards.” — Globe's Finest
“Playing Arts is a 54 card deck where every card is accompanied with incredible art, from the lowly two of clubs all the way to the ace of spades and of course those dastardly jokers.” — Trend Hunter
“Playing Arts is a vibrant, varied and contemporary, an ideal Christmas gift for every poker player in the world.” — Gods of Art
“If you’d like to add an artistic touch to your next Poker game, you’ll absolutely love these playing cards by Digital Abstracts.” — Holy Cool
“The deck looks simply stunning. Featuring photography, digital illustration, hand drawn designs and typography, each card is created with the artist’s individual style.” — Design Distilled
_
Want to feature Playing Arts in your resource?
Download Press Kit with hi-res images
__
Video credits:
Footage shot by: December Boys
Music: Panthurr
__
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have a lot of experience releasing the decks, but making a physical product is always a challenge and implies various risks, especially when there are so many people involved.

The main challenge for us is to meet the timeline. We've carefully planned each step according to our previous experience, but yet there is a chance that something may take more time than it was planned. We'll be working hard not to let this happen, keep you informed about the process and deliver your rewards as planned.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

And it's now available here, on Kickstarter.
