campaign.story:
Dear Kickstarter backers,
The story of Pictar began 9 years ago at the Mac-World show in San Francisco: Steve Jobs was standing on the huge stage, wearing his usual jeans and black turtleneck. Toward the end of his presentation, Jobs excitedly introduced the first iPhone, and just like that he changed the world of photography as we know it.
iPhone 1 Introduction
The fact that the iPhone is part of our life 24/7, along with the most updated technology Apple engineers continuously pour into it, the ease with which superb images can be produced and its addictive sharing capabilities, have turned the iPhone into the most popular camera in the world. That's why it's not surprising to discover that more than 75% of all the photos taken in the world in 2015 were done by smartphones.
It's almost impossible today to find someone who doesn't take pictures with a Smartphone - from little kids who can hardly hold their parent's iPhone but love taking pictures, to seasoned pros who are not ashamed to pull out their iPhone 6S to capture a fleeting moment in the street or document a process on a professional mission. We are fortunate to witness history in the making...
But is everything really that perfect?
The iPhone camera, and the strong competitors from the East, have made meteoric progress since the first device was introduced with its modest 2 megapixel images. Today they offer photographic technology that matches the standards of professional cameras.
The problem is that these advanced cameras are packed inside a smartphone. The thin, sleek and slick device doesn't offer any secure external grip or controls with the characteristics of traditional DSLR cameras we've come to appreciate.
The iPhone's camera technology has made huge progress since first introduced - but we still take pictures in an uncomfortable and unsafe way - just like 9 years ago. It's time for a change
Along with the availability of the smartphone, we’ve become accustomed to (or rather, we have compromised on) two matters of principle: First, we still use the smartphone's camera in the most awkward way, and pray it doesn't slip out of our fingers and fall to the ground (and indeed sometimes it doesn't); and secondly, most of us never utilize even a fraction of the iPhone camera's enormous potential, because no one has the time or patience to browse through endless internal menus.
The result? In most cases, we shoot in auto mode and compromise on picture quality. It's like coupling a Formula One engine with a steering wheel and gearbox of a golf cart - the engine's potential just cannot reach the road... no matter how skilled the driver is.
Pictar was born to help mobile-photographers to unleash the power of the iPhone’s camera for much better pictures!
Feels like real camera. Shoots like real camera.
Pictar was born to combine the benefits of advanced cameras - IE, full external control of all shooting functions as well as a stable and secure grip, with the advanced camera technology and ultimate availability of the iPhone. In other words - to unleash the full potential of iPhone's photographic capability in order to take much better pictures, time after time! It's pretty cool, but who is it designed for? Pictar is designed for people who are just starting out in photography and are looking to get more out of their iPhone, as well as serious amateur or professional photographers who want ultimate and uncompromising control over the iPhone's camera. No matter what's your level or experience - Pictar will help you get much more from your iPhone!
We invite you to dive in (and scroll down) to learn more about Pictar and what it can do for you and your iPhone:
The real thing - just like a pro DSLR!
Electronically calibrated to provide maximum sensitivity, just like a traditional DSLR. Pictar’s shutter button offers a "half press" mode to lock focus and exposure for easy tracking of a moving object or to create a desired composition, as well as full-press for immediate shutter release. The button is located right under the index finger to enable precise and intuitive shooting, with one hand.
Tip: if you're shooting in a cold environment, or taking pictures of extreme sports, you'll be happy to learn that with Pictar's shutter button you can now take pictures on an iPhone with your gloves!

Half-press to lock focus and exposure. Press to shoot - even with gloves.
 Zoom with only one hand.
Located right below the shutter release button, the rotating zoom ring does away with the need to touch the screen to pinch-and-zoom, and makes it easy for the user to zoom in and out with just one hand. The zoom ring can also be re-programmed by user to suit specific needs, such as the flash, white-balance, etc. if that's the case, zoom in or out will be done by "pinching" the iPhone's screen, like before.
  Let the fun begin!
Clicking the zoom ring will switch between the iPhone's front and back camera for easy "selfie" shots. Like the rotation of the zoom ring, the button can also be re-programmed by user to suit specific needs and control other settings.
Tip: Changed to "selfie" mode? Shooting one-handed? You can use the zoom ring for perfect composition, and shoot pictures you'll love to share.  
 Control light like never before!
Strategically located in the right corner is the exposure compensation wheel, which lets the user quickly and easily control brightness level even before shooting. And just like with an advanced camera, the exposure compensation wheel changes the exposure in steps of 1/3 aperture, and the clear display appears at the bottom of the iPhone screen.
Tip: In manual mode, the exposure compensation wheel changes its designation and allows control of ISO values.
 Fully customizable, the smart wheel allows users to control a variety of functions.
Beginners will love the ease of control - in default mode the smart wheel controls 7 pre-set modes, which enable users to easily adjust the iPhone to any situation while focusing on actually taking the shot. Pre-set modes are:
Auto mode
Portrait mode
Landscape mode
Sport mode
Snow mode
Selfie mode
Video mode
Advanced photographers will feel right at home: the smart wheel lets you choose between 3 advanced modes:
Shutter priority
ISO priority
Manual (iPhone manual = Shutter + ISO adjustments).
The Virtual Wheel is another great feature that allows the user to control different modes such as Flash modes, Shutter speed, ISO and more - simply by using his thumb. Switching between modes is done by using the Smart Wheel.
Feel like you're holding a real camera
The iPhone is an amazing design icon, and we as designers are full of admiration for the people who brought it to the world - but let's face it: as a camera, it's nowhere near the comfort, safe feel and familiar grip of a traditional camera. So the second task we undertook - after developing advanced controls - was to design an ergonomic grip that would sit comfortably in one hand and let you take one-handed shots while holding it out the window of a speeding jeep. And we believe we did it! 
Pictar's grip is coated with anti-slip material and gives you something solid to grasp on one hand, while being compact enough to provide what we love about smartphones - accessibility and ease of storage. Pictar lets you take one-handed shots, anywhere, without falling out of your grasp. It provides sharp images thanks to the steady grip. We think it also looks great, with its trendy retro design inspired by classic cameras we love. Your iPhone will love it.
Saves time looking for your iPhone so you'll never miss a shot or have your precious phone fall. 
It's rare to see a camera that isn't connected to a strap. So when we developed Pictar, we knew we wanted to design not one but two straps: a wrist strap to secure it against falling, and a neck strap for carrying. The classic Pictar kit offers a standard adjustable wrist strap with a fast connection clasp. The Pictar-Plus kit includes a neck strap too - which also connects to the same fast connection clasp.
Tip: You can easily change between them or disconnect them both.
The padded case will keep your PICTAR safe when not in use.
Easily connect any tripod, for sharper than ever images
The mobile-camera revolution enables anyone to go out into the wild - jungle or city - armed with just an iPhone. There they discover that they sometimes lack a trusty buddy - a tripod. There are many ways to improvise, but you won't always find a convenient tree or flat rock to stabilize the iPhone when you really could use a tripod.
That's why it was important to us to incorporate a standard 1/4" thread in Pictar, just like real cameras have.
Stable and reliable cold-shoe connector - for many camera accessory - not just iPhone oriented.
The market offers an endless choice of LED-based lighting devices which add a fascinating dimension of light to the creative process. The problem is that many of them - especially the professional ones - are designed to be connected to real cameras with a standard upper connection. So Pictar offers a reliable and stable cold-shoe connection to hook up anything you want - via Pictar - to your iPhone.
NOTE:
PICTAR's App does not support hand-held flash units.
The cold shoe mount can support lighting units weighs up to 300 gr. / 0,66 pounds.
Due to the fact that while it attached to PICTAR, the iPhone's connecting jack is concealed - any device that is using the connecting jack must be disconnected before actual attachment to PICTAR.
Pictar's semi-open body allows connecting most "clip-on" lenses. We've tested it with olloclip lens, and it works great. 
Mode shown: SPORT
A powerful, dedicated app featuring patented high-frequency dual tone sound control.
Pictar is designed to communicate with iPhone via a dedicated camera app which unlocks key features inaccessible on the native app to iPhone users. Each of the physical controls found on Pictar drive a specific function or setting and does so using high-frequency dual tone sounds. 
Each physical control is assigned a specific tone, and with each turn of a dial, press of a button or turn of a wheel, Pictar emits a sound that – when detected by the app – generates a corresponding action. The high-frequency dual tone (18,500 – 20,000 khz) is inaudible to the human ear and significantly increases battery life when compared to Bluetooth connectivity. 
High-frequency dual tone technology saves energy compared to "Bluetooth" systems.
Using a standard CR ½ AA battery, we estimates 4-6 months of use before the need to replace the power source is required.
We are offering two almost identical models who share the same features. PICTAR fits iPhone models 4 to 6S while PICTAR PLUS fits iPhone 6 PLUS and iPhone  6S PLUS.
Models shown: 4s, 5s, 6s
Perhaps one of the biggest challenges in the development process was how to let as many iPhone users benefit from Pictar, without making it too expensive by adding various adapters. The solution consists of two elements:
1: Wireless connection between Pictar and the iPhone using high-frequency sound waves (see separate chapter);
2: A modular mechanical connection to connect different model iPhones of different sizes. The result - Pictar fits most existing iPhone models, and is ready for future models. If any backer plans to upgrade one day to a new model iPhone - chances are that it will fit.
Tip: If you have numerous iPhones in the family, you can share Pictar without a problem by installing Pictar-Up (free) on all devices.
Can I use my iPhone cover with Pictar?
Pictar’s semi-open body design doesn't allow to connect a case while attaching the iPhone. 
The only exception is the iPhone 6 / 6s that can be fitted with a silicon case - similar to Apple’s original “Silicon Case”.
And what about Pictar for Android?
The decision to develop Pictar for iPhone only was not easy, and it required a lot of thought and long discussions into the night. In the end we have our reasons:
1. Development of app and operating system: Thanks to Apple's unified OS it was easier for us to develop software for iPhone than Android, so we decided to focus the project to avoid wasting resources and valuable time.
 2. The physical size - the iPhone comes in a limited number of models. Android phones come in so many different shapes, sizes and thicknesses, it was easier for our designers to develop a body that fits most iPhone models then to tackle countless Android models.
3. Focus! The Pictar project was extremely challenging - even for companies much bigger than miggo. So it was important for us to focus only on iPhones so we could come up with a production-ready prototype as quickly as possible - and make it as good as can be. Diversification on many platforms would have diverted us from our goal.
                                                                                                                          From dream to reality
Eighteen months ago, Guy - one of the miggo partners - stole two hours of breathing space between meetings in New York to travel to the Ground Zero memorial site. Guy is an avid photographer but he left his DSLR in the office, so all he had on him to document the exciting site was his iPhone. The images he was able to shoot frustrated him to the point that he decided that the next miggo project will be an advanced grip-control for iPhone photographers.
Fast-forward 6 months: the miggo team prepare first sketches and begin to formulate designs. Very quickly we realized we were looking for a grip that will provide external control of the advanced and powerful iPhone camera. The process included searching for a suitable design concept of the Pictar body - one that resembled a camera without being too cumbersome.
At the same time we carried out a proper characterization of camera features which we would like to control externally: exposure, zoom, electronic shutter release, and more. Design took shape quite quickly - we knew from the start that it would look and feel like a classic camera. We examined a large number of sketches till we finally focused on the current direction. As you can see in the pictures, the process eventually led to the final result that we really love.
Searching for the perfect shape
The next stage was the most difficult - how to make the external buttons operate the iPhone camera without a physical connection? The easiest solution - Bluetooth - was thrown out due to its tendency to "hog" power like there's no tomorrow, from both the iPhone itself and the grip.
Advanced 3D-printing models
Alona and Dan
A surprising solution came from an engineer who worked with us - using high-frequency sound waves of 18500-20000 kHz. The idea is that each external control emits a dual frequency when operated, that isn't detected by the human ear. Frequency duplication distinguishes between the frequencies produced by Pictar and similar frequencies that exist in the environment, thus avoiding false commands.
The specialized operating system we developed receives the frequencies and translates them into an order that results in an action. The great advantage of the system is its zero power consumption. A standard CR ½ AA battery in Pictar can last for up to 6 months, with reasonable use.
The picture above shows "Albert" - the experimental motherboard specially designed to simulate what Pictar knows how to do today. Clicking on each of the five buttons activating a high frequency which controlled the camera.
While developing the voice system, we designed a dedicated app in collaboration with one of the best companies in the country. The app - free of course - offers even more control in terms of what the iPhone camera allows.
We also added straps and a padded pouch to keep everything nice and safe, and we were ready to go. So this is it - we are ready to manufacture and hope for the best. Looking back - this past year was exciting, challenging and especially intense for the development team, but the result is worth it all.
You may ask who we are and why are we here for the 3rd time?! Thanks for asking!
Frankly, we believe in Kickstarter.
We believe the crowd funding is the best way for a small and ambitious company like us to quickly and efficiently reach the people for whom we work so hard to develop breakthrough products.
We like to listen.
Kickstarter is a wonderful place to hear exactly what people think about your product - long before it reaches the market. Just think about it - this is the best, largest and most professional focus group in the world! Your knowledge is invaluable and what's really cool is that people are happy to share their knowledge and experience - to help developers like us bring to market products that might not have been developed using the traditional way.
These are just some of the reasons we're here for the third time. This, and the adrenaline rush the campaign gives us, after so much hard work developing a product that we totally believe in.
We were here 2 years ago with our strap&wrap - the world's first camera strap that morphs into a compact protective carrier. The campaign raised 400% above target and our young company received a huge infusion of energy to continue developing innovative products.
A year ago we were back again with agua - an ipx3 storm-proof quick-draw camera holster - this time we raised 800% of what we asked for, with only 2000 amazing backers. It gave us a lot of confidence and resources to continue.
In the 3 years that miggo has been around, we have developed over 10 new products with Kickstarter, and these products have been successfully sent to all backers and are also sold in over 30 countries around the world - in four different continents.
Dear Kickstarter backers,
We've come back to ask for your support again - help us bring Pictar to production and lend us a hand in changing the world of photography.
Please join us by supporting Pictar or sharing this page with your friends and family. Any help will be appreciated for ever!
Thank YOU!
Team miggo
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We're not novices and our team has decades of collective experience in the development and production of complex products. Precisely because of this reason, we know that unexpected delays sometimes happen during manufacturing. To minimize risks, we have taken the following actions:

1. We are assisted by a British engineering company which is a leader in its field in Europe. The company specializes in bringing products similar to Pictar to manufacturing stage, so we can ensure Pictar will enter production without a flaw.

2. We secured an agreement with a leading European-owned manufacturer located in China, with a wealth of experience and a proven track record in the field of plastics, metal and delicate electronics.

3. Our schedule takes into account unexpected delays, and the financial target we have set allows us to produce, pack and ship Pictar orders without any problems, so we are confident we can meet our commitments.

4. In addition, this is the third time on Kickstarter and we have an impeccable reputation. In our two previous projects we successfully delivered to 100% of our backers - a total of over 3,500. In both cases, the reactions were excellent. So we are confident in our ability to successfully stand by our obligations.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
I did an original piece of art once a week for a full year and took it to a different business each week. Then I published a post on my Medium account with the business’ address and a little information about what they do and why I chose them. Whoever was following the project could go to that business in person and pick up the art for free, I just asked that in return they support that business in some way, like by buying something from them or posting about it online to help spread awareness. 
Diane Campbell, owner of The Candy Store, week #41’s featured business, said, “We were so happy to be part of Vincent’s amazing project, ‘52 Pick Up’. His piece created quite the buzz and the person who took it home was so excited.”
And from Maura Boland, owner of Alaskan Premium Seafood,“Vincent’s article on my business gave me hope that my dream could continue. And it has indeed! I am forever grateful to have been asked to be a part of this and to see what comes from this gentleman. I am watching in awe at all he gives the world with this art and generosity!”
"Green Apple was honored to be a part of Vincent's 52 Pick Up project. Any marriage of art and locally owned independent business is AOK in our book!" - Pete Mulvihill, owner, Green Apple Books
52 Pick Up - Week 1 - 826 Valencia
52 Pick Up - Week 23 - Maison d’Etre
52 Pick Up - Week 47 - Huckleberry Bicycles
52 Pick Up - Week 39 - Rare Device
52 Pick Up - Week 46 - Weathered Nest
Meeting with Zack Stender of Huckleberry Bicycles - Week 47
The Book
I want to produce a book about my 2015 art project, 52 Pick Up, that captures the experience and highlights the character and personalities that make up the cities we live in. From design options to shipping costs, I learned a great deal from self-publishing my last book and I want to take this book to the next level. My plan is to make another limited edition of 1000 museum quality books to celebrate and further benefit these independent shops. This 60+ page hardcover book will feature all 52 small businesses featured in the project, some interior design photography of the local shops, my experience throughout the year and all the original weekly pieces of art. Check out some of the prototype ideas below.
My plan after I satisfy all the Kickstarter backer rewards and deliver those books, is to distribute any remaining books amongst all 52 small businesses. They can keep 100% of the proceeds from their book sales.
Concept Design Of Wood Book Cover
Prototype Title Page
Prototype Art Page
Prototype Interior Page
The Backstory
In 2013, I gave away 365 pieces of my original art as a gift each day to the first person to ask for it, anywhere in the world. It was an amazing experience. Project 365 culminated in a 9x12-inch, 316-page, two time award winning book whose proceeds went to benefit the Children’s Creativity Museum in San Francisco. 
Project 365 Book
Example Finished Project 365 Books
Project 365 Book: Example Interior Page
Project 365 Book: Colored Head and Tail Bands
The Cost
When I did the Project 365 book, I learned a great deal about what goes into producing a museum, high quality art book. I grossly underestimated my first Kickstarter campaign and estimated a goal of $11,000. I ended up using thicker, coated art paper, colored head and tail bands, hardcover stock, blind debossing the title into the cover, cloth bounding and running a special edition slipcase. My shipping charges were $60 per international book and I was selling the book on my campaign for $60 so that was a wash. And while it's mentioned in the fine print, I just didn't consider the 8% crowd funding fees which came off the top of my budget too. The quantity of books also play a big role and the per unit price will greatly depend on how many books are produced. I ended up with a total cost of roughly $20,000 to produce the book I wanted in both design and quantity. I was fortunate enough to raise $20,526 during my campaign, but the 8% of fees brought my total budget to $18,883.92.
Even though the art was free, I'd never want to sacrifice quality in regard to the production of the books. It's important to me that the quality of the book lives up to the same standard so I personally covered any balance to make sure it was done right. After a year of hard work between my designer and I, the book was recognized and awarded "Outstanding Book Of The Year: Best Book Arts Craftsmanship" by the IPPY Awards and "Best Art Book" by the 2015 USA Best Book Awards. 
I'm really excited about this new book and being able to use all the past knowledge and experience to make it. I've determined this book will estimate at a cost of $20,354.00 which will cover all the design options, shipping charges and fees to produce. Of course, there could be minor design changes that will potentially shift this number up or down, but I will work with Global PSD to make sure it fits within budget. If the Kickstarter campaign goes beyond the funding goal, well, I'll just make an even higher quality book. :)
The Specs
Approximately 60-70 pages. This is still under development as we're working out the final design. 
The hardcover will be wood with the title burned into the cover, mimicking a vintage business sign. 
Cloth spine with blind debossing
Dimensions approximately 9 x 9 inches 
Smythe swen book binding 
Colored head and tail bands 
157 GSM art paper 
The giclée prints are produced on an Epson 9900 utilizing the 11 color high dynamic range inkset, which results in a wide color gamut. Paper is conservation grade and acid free.
The Schedule
A rough outline of the schedule looks like the following, although is subject to change based on any unforeseen production delays.
Kickstarter Campaign: April - May
Design: Layout and copy: June - July
Book Production: July - September
Bulk Shipment to San Francisco: October
Packaging and signing: November
Out For Delivery: December
The Faces Behind the Window Sign
I want to thank and give recognition to all 52 small business that were a part of 52 Pick Up! Again, If this campaign is successful and the goal is met, my plan is to take any remaining books after shipping them to Kickstarter backers and distribute them amongst the shops below: 
826 Valencia • Poverty & the Arts • Tibon’s Goju-Ryu Fighting Arts Karate • 082010 • cahoots handbags • Schmancy • Sound Spirits • Iron Oxide Art Supplies • Central Features • Alishan Organics • Starry Eyes • encuentro • Molding Plastic Corp. • ReFind • Alaskan Premium Seafoods • Inhabitect • Heartfelt • Esqueleto • Glaser Designs • Ampersand • Mercy vintage now • Cheese Plus • Maison d'Etre • Books & Books • Hollow • Cactus Jungle • Cafe Renzo • Asmbly Hall • Socola Chocolatier • Castle In The Air • DSF Clothing Co. • Green Apple Books • Beachside Coffee Bar + Kitchen • Lucinda’s • Tantrum • Chocolate Covered • Paul’s Hat Works • Rickshaw Bagworks • Rare Device • Urban Bazaar • The Candy Store • Tigerlily • Love & Luxe • Baia Pasta • Good Stock • Weathered Nest • Huckleberry Bicycles • David James • Mill Valley Flowers • Wood Thumb • Local Take • Perch
The Rewards
Your name included on the acknowledgments page for being such a cool patron of the arts! :)
A Thank You postcard, a signed limited edition giclée print of an image from 52 Pick Up AND your name included on the acknowledgments page of the book.
A Thank You postcard, a signed hardcover copy of the 52 Pick Up book AND your name included on the acknowledgments page.
A Thank You postcard, a signed hardcover copy of the 52 Pick Up book, your name included on the acknowledgments page AND a limited edition signed giclée print.

campaign.story:
THE STRETCH
Stretch Goal unlocked. White-Ti Oi now available
THE TALK
THE WHAT 
We’ve designed a bicycle bell, Oi. We think it’s a bit different. We hope you like it. If you do, why not help us bring it to life?
Hello
THE WHY
Bike bells have been domed since they were invented in 1877. In which time we’ve sent man to the moon, cloned a sheep, and created hundreds of different styles of beautiful bicycle, yet not reimagined this simple analogue device. What if it wasn’t a dome? What if it didn’t protrude from your handle bar like a blister?
Oh dear
We set out to design a totally new bell where form and function played an equal part. A bell with a beautiful tone, but also a remarkable style and choice of materials that embodies a rider’s personality. We wanted to embrace a variety of riding genres, without compromising any.
THE WHO
Knog is a bike accessory brand that is well know for its innovative design in bicycle lights and locks. Until now, we haven't focused on the humble bell. So what better way to test a revolutionary new product design than put it up on Kickstarter?
Some Knog characters
We're designers first. A small team of hungry engineers and industrial & graphics creatives who like to challenge everything. Especially the basics. Especially the stuff that people don’t think is worth changing. Yep, that’s the stuff we like changing. 
THE HOW 
The Oi bell's shape originates from its home - the handle bar. Our design team explored hundreds of iterations in designing the style. Then tested and prototyped different widths, depths, materials, curvature, actuators, springs and more to get to the optimum design. 
Step 1: Scribbling
Step 2: CADing (is that a word?)
Step 3: Prototyping
As with all our designs that reach this stage, we have applied for patent and registered the design. //Design Registration applied for: No. 201610483 //Provisional Patent applied for: No. 2016900305
THE LOOK 
Where bells usually protrude up or out, Oi doesn’t. It appears to hover around the handle bars. In one sense, it's discreet. But in another, it stands out as unrecognisable.  
Yum
Saucy
THE SOUND 
We tested numerous prototypes to get the perfect pitch, length of ring, and volume. With a spring-loaded actuator built into the mount, the strike of the bell is firm and fast, allowing a good balance of volume and longevity of sound. Our bell actually has several pitch tones - one core and several supportive higher tones to ensure it's unmistakable and safely heard. To compare it to a musical instrument, where some bells play a single note, Oi plays a chord. Hear it here for yourself...
PLAY

The bell-off...
PLAY

THE FINISHES
From left to right: Aluminium, Titanium, Brass, Copper, Black
There are five styles. The standard aluminium model comes in 4 finishes: brushed aluminium; brass-plated; copper-plated; and black. The top of the range, "treat yourself” model is made from titanium. 
THE SIZE AND SPEC 
The bells fit on almost all cylindrical bars. The SML Oi is for the common 22.2mm bar, and with the "spacers" that come in the pack, the LRG Oi is for all bar sizes up to 31.8mm. The Oi will also work on any aero bar with a 16mm cylindrical section (usually near the stem). 
Deets
After you pledge, we'll be in touch to ask for your choice of size.
THE MOUNT 
What about the handle-bar cables? No worries. Built into the shape of the mount is a cable management system. So not only does it allow the bell to look and sound uninterrupted, it also helps gather your cables (for the organiser inside us all).
What about getting it on the bar. Again, not a thing. Just pop it over, give it a quick tighten up, and you're good to go. No sliding down the handlebars, no dismantling and re-assembling.
Easy on. No need to remove grips or cables.
Manage your cables
THE OI
WE WILL CONTACT YOU AFTER THE CAMPAIGN (EARLY APRIL) TO REQUEST FOLLOWING INFO: 
SIZE
FINISH 
ENGRAVING TEXT (for "Bells and Whistles")
DELIVERY ADDRESS 
---
GALLERY
Thank you, backers.

This project is promoted by Jellop, a direct response online advertising agency specializing in Kickstarter campaigns on Facebook Ads and Google AdWords.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Production:
We’re in the fortunate position of having many years of experience designing and manufacturing bike products. Therefore, we understand the risks that can occur in the production process. As with any physical item, flaws not picked up in the rigorous testing phase are possible. That’s why Knog offers warranty on parts and production of 24 months.

Delivery:
One challenge we have considered is blasting past our funding goal and coping with a larger direct-to-consumer delivery than we're used to. However, we have already planned for this and have lined up several options for third party logistics, all of whom have crowdfunding expertise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

It's been a while since you've had a Kickstarter update from us, and we have big news. Knog are bringing another product to market right here, and we're as proud of this one, as we were of the Oi bell. 
One of the elements that Knog loves most about Kickstarter is the input and feedback we receive from our backers. campaign.story:
Welcome to my 11th Kickstarter Project!
I want to start by saying... Thank You ALL for the support!
I don't expect this project to get anywhere near as big as my previous projects, however if we hit 100k in funding... everyone gets a FREE Ti-MQR! Which means lots of sharing on social media :)
*I am not a photographer, pictures taken with cell phone then uploaded to Instagram - https://instagram.com/tacticalkeychains/
---
Click for Instagram
 I strive to make the best USABLE EDC Keychains on the planet.
What are the uses of Ti-MQR?
Hang just about anything on metal (keys, tools, etc)
Use it to have your #TUKK ready at any moment ;)
Use it as just a standard magnet to hang stuff on the fridge :)
Use it with Para-cord (like the original Para-TiMaG)
Use it to hold posters up on drywall screws, no more holes!
Magnetic quick release (yep, like the name says)
Use it for your hidden front door or shed key
Hang an extra key for your car, under your car! (yes, this is a neat trick)
Grab the sewing needle out of the sewing machine (yep, wife is helping)
It's basically limitless
Video of how I use my Ti-MQR
Click for Instagram Post
You don't have to use the Ti-MQR for what it is, you can use them individually. Remember TiMaG? Well these are basically the "Para-cord version" of those, only smaller and more pocket friendly.
---
Ti-MQR Specs
Neodymium Magnet Strength ~4lb pull each*
While this is 1.5lb pull less than my currently available "TK-MQR", the Ti-MQR is stronger(Titanium), lighter and shorter. (wish I could say faster, lol)
*Magnet Manufacturer specs
Short Video of Ti-MQR to show magnet strength
---
Color Options
Click for Instagram Post
Left to right: Stonewash, Bronze, Purple, Blue, Sea
---
Backer Questions
What is difference between your TK-MQR and the NEW Ti-MQR?
Click for Instagram Post
 As you can see above, the main change is Size. The set of Ti-MQR is a 1/4" shorter over all then the TK-MQR. It may not seem like much, but it is noticeable.  The Ti-MQR magnets are also a little weaker, however I haven't noticed it.
Can I pledge for more than one Reward?
I have introduced "packs" into the rewards, for this project please don't add on to your pledge like past projects. (Unless you are in the "quick draw reward")  The complexity on my end is already high, even tho it may not seem like it. We will have different color options which is hard to keep track of if adding on to your pledge.  I'm sorry if there isn't a Pack that suits your needs on this project.
Aren't your prices kind of high?
Well, remember you are getting 2 (1 set). Lets look back to TiMaG, a 4 pack of para-cord mags were $56. Which translates to 2 sets of Ti-MQR for $36. So why is it $20 cheaper? It's cheaper because I know what I'm doing now, haha - no really. I have learned how to be more efficient.  I now have better equipment, etc.  So... I pass the savings on to you for supporting my project :) How often does that happen?
What are the key rings you are using in the pictures?
They are the FREEkey accessory rings.  I originally included them with TK-MQR, however many people didn't care for them and used their own rings.  Currently no rings are included, but that may change as the project goes on. (shh... like Titanium key rings ;) )
---
Production of Ti-MQR
Click for Instagram Post
The production will be 100% Transparent to the backer, I will provide YouTube and Instagram videos/pictures throughout the whole process. So come see how the Ti-MQR is made!
Wife wanted to help model the Purple Ti-MQR :)
Click for Instagram Post
Thanks for the support!
Brad & Family
p.s. Credits for the "Functionally simple, reliably advanced" goes to @kevinkillsit on Instagram!

Read Before You Pledge and Use the Magnets

- Disclaimer: Tactical Keychains LLC (Owner of tacticalkeychains.com) neither assumes nor accepts any liability for damages resulting from the handling or use of these magnets. With your pledge, the backer confirms that you have read and understood the following warnings. The backer agrees that he or she is responsible for all damages and injuries caused by the magnets; which includes, property damages or personal injuries. The backer must also check local laws before pledging. The backer must agree with the terms before they pledge to purchase the magnets. Pull forces that Tactical Keychains LLC provides is an estimate only and Tactical Keychains LLC is not responsible for any inaccuracy of magnet pull force.

- Neodymium magnets are very strong. Handling them with care is necessary to prevent personal injuries or property damages. Be Responsible and use in a safe manor.

- KEEP AWAY FROM CHILDREN, OR ANYONE WITH A MENTAL DISORDER!

- Neodymium magnets are brittle; they can be broken with impact. Wear gloves and protective glasses when handling these magnets, because pieces could disengage and fly at your eyes or other body parts and stab you.

- Learn more about Magnet Safety here - http://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/preview/mmwrhtml/mm5548a3.htm

- The strong magnetic fields of these Neodymium magnets can damage pace-makers or other bodily implants, keep a minimum of 4 feet distance from such devices.

- Any time "magnet(s) is used in this project, it is assumed as "Ti-MQR or TK-MQR"

- Children should not be allowed to handle magnets as they can be very dangerous. Especially small magnets as they pose a choking hazard and should never be swallowed or inserted into the body.

This is a Living document and can be changed at any time, please see my website for an updated document.

campaign.story:
Hello I’m Brian, thanks for visiting my project! I’m a design engineer/maker/small business starter and I’ve successfully completed 7 previous Kickstarter projects to date.
I’ve been able to create the Strong Like Bull Magnets brand and product line through multiple projects on Kickstarter. Magnets are cool and useful… and my previous projects have been well received. I’m returning to Kickstarter to try to further broaden the SLB magnet lineup… this time with a smaller version I call TackMags.
Shaped like thumb tacks, TackMags are perfect for your refrigerator, whiteboard, or any steel surface you’d like to ‘tack’ something to. 
I'm certainly not the first person ever to make a tack shaped magnet, but hopefully you'll like my unique version... a strong neodymium magnet coupled to a cool custom machined aluminum housing which as always sports the stamped Strong Like Bull logo (I still remember sketching the logo going on a few years ago now).
Designed to be not too small and not too large... TackMags utilize custom 8mm diameter high grade Neodymium Iron Boron magnets that have a respectable 'axially pull' specification of almost 6 lbs.  Axial pull specs are always a bit hard to visualize, so I like to describe magnet strength in terms of how many sheets of full size paper a single magnet will hold to a typical refrigerator... for TackMags, it's 21!  So for 'tacking' up a few envelopes, pictures, pizza coupons, or your kid's artwork... you're all set with these!
While they’re not the strongest magnets I've made, they still have a good amount of hold, much more than your average refrigerator magnet and the shape makes them easy to grasp and remove.
I plan to deliver a certain portion of the rewards in December, for delivery prior to Christmas (timing requires this to be for US backers only). I've got machine shop time locked up already to make sure I can meet that goal.  If all of the limited quantity 'December delivery' rewards get pledged for, these 'overflow' rewards are scheduled for February fulfillment (along with any international backer rewards).
To keep things manageable, December TackMags are only being offered in a silver aluminum anodized finish.  If there ends up being 'overflow rewards' for February, I might add some anodize color options for those.
TackMags will be packaged in clear 6-pack tubes making them super cool, super unique holiday gifts! Rewards are available from 1 to 5 individual six-pack tubes.  If you are looking for some awesome stocking stuffers, look no further!
TackMags start with a custom machined aluminum magnet housing. I use my hobby lathe to make prototypes until I’m happy with the design.
If the funding is successful, I will work with a professional machine shop to produce production quantities.  I can make some nice parts myself, but I'm pretty slow;)
The machined aluminum parts then go to a finishing shop to be anodized. Anodization is a hardcoat process to keep the magnets scratch free so they’ll look good for a lifetime.  This time around, I'm going to have the machined parts sand blasted prior to anodize to get that textured, shimmery high-end look.
Next comes the logo. I'm stamping after anodize this time around... this will save time and since I'm having these parts sandblasted, stamping afterwards will keep the logo crisp.  The big goal of my last project (Stick Magnets) was to fund the purchase of an ‘impact stamp press’ to allow for more precise and repeatable logo stamping.  
The impact press has been a great addition! Prior to having the press, I would stamp all the parts I made manually using a hand stamp and hammer (yes really!). The press works great and will be again utilized to mark the SLB logo on TackMags.
The last step is installing the high grade neodymium magnet. While I work with a machine shop to produce production quantity aluminum housing parts, I do all of the final assembly, inspection, packaging, and shipping myself. 
I stepped up packaging a bit on this project to make the magnets a bit more 'present-able'.  Cool, clear tubes, with an SLB logo cap.
While I've managed to build Strong Like Bull Magnets into a small business, I still find it useful to test the waters on Kickstarter before committing to a new product addition.  Beyond gauging 'market interest', a successful Kickstarter provides me with scale... or the ability to order materials and components in large quantities to get prices to an attractive level. So if you're interested in some custom magnets, as always, I'd appreciate your support!
As noted above, I have lots of experience and a good track record on Kickstarter. Big thanks to Kickstarter for such a cool platform!
Lastly, you can keep track of me at these places...
Website: StrongLikeBullMagnets.com or SLBmagnets.com
Blog: SpokeDesignBlog.com
twitter:  @SLBmagnets
Instagram: @stronglikebullmagnets
Facebook: StrongLikeBullMagnets
Also... if you back for one on the 'December Delivery' reward tiers, please make sure you have your email & update notifications turned on for this project so you don't miss the Survey notice... timing is tight on this one, so if we fund, I'll need surveys done promptly:)

While I design and make prototypes myself, I do rely on outside shops for production quantities of parts. I have good relationships with my suppliers, but again, I count on them to delivery on time so I can assemble, pack, and ship rewards. I work hard to make it happen!

campaign.story:
INTRODUCING the world's warmest neck gaiter, with stash pocket for all your mountain essentials. Whether your on the slopes or a brisk winter run, The Neck Gaiter will keep you warmer than ever before. 
Designed in the USA. Ships before Christmas.
Starting at only $15.
Why Polar Fleece? 
Polar Fleece it known in the ski/snow/outdoor performance industries as a hydrophobic insulator - this means it helps you retain your heat even when wet. Polar fleece holds less than 1% of its weight in water - so feel free to shred through the deepest powder with no worries at all.
Additionally, our Polar Fleece milling process is Green - with the same carbon footprint as wool production. However, each Polar Fleece product boasts MUCH longer durability, therefore reducing emissions per consumer over time.
Accessing the stash pocket is easy - and it too is lined with polar fleece, so it's soft to the touch. 
Use the micro-zip to easily open the stash pocket, then store your mountain/urban essentials.
What size should I get?
The Neck Gaiter comes in one size that fits all - old and young, big and small. No need to worry about sizing for this gift - if they're human, it'll fit ;) 
40-45% of body heat is lost from the head - The Neck Gaiter covers the top of the neck, base of the skull, and lower face. The Neck Gaiter worn in combination with a hat is a sure-fire way to stay warm in the coldest of colds. 
However, the gaiter DOES come in different colors, so take your pick, or buy a pack, and get a gaiter to match each one of your ski jackets. Choose Jet Black, Slate, Candy, or all three!
Specify the number of gaiters you want with your pledge level - You'll get to pick your specific colors in the post-campaign survey! We've already got plenty of Jet Black, Slate, and Candy in stock, so you don't have to worry about selling out of the color you want!

campaign.story:
Pulse is the most powerful way to control your camera from your smartphone. Pulse plugs into your DSLR or Mirrorless camera's USB port, so whether you're shooting photos, time lapse, or video, you get complete creative freedom - remotely from your smartphone - with your current camera. 
ISO, Aperture, and Shutter Speed Control
Pulse's strength comes from its 100' bluetooth low energy radio, advanced USB control software, and a beautifully designed interface. We wanted a product that could handle your biggest project ideas - from day-long time lapses to your next backpacking trip. Because of its size you can take Pulse anywhere, and thanks to what it can do you'll never want to leave it behind. 
Get image thumbnails wirelessly on your phone.
With image preview you can view thumbnails on your phone right after you take a photo, at a range of up to 100 feet. Whether your camera is sticking out a 5th floor window or you're warming up while it braves the cold, Pulse has you covered so you can still get the perfect shot.
Pulse plugs into your camera's USB port and is compatible with just about any Canon or Nikon DSLR (and now the Panasonic GH4), and the Pulse app is free for both iPhone and Android devices. Want to confirm that your camera is compatible? Check the FAQ at the bottom of this page.
Want Pulse to work with your Sony camera?! So do we! See the FAQ for the full explanation.
Get group photos, without having to race back into the shot.
Whether you're part of the shot, or not, there are a lot of times where it is just nice not to have to stand behind your camera. With Pulse, you can set up your camera and trigger it from anywhere in the room. Pulse's Bluetooth connection allows you to roam as you need to and gives you a range of up to 100 feet from your camera.
Glacier Point, Yosemite
Shooting in low light requires you to keep your camera absolutely still. Pulse makes it easier than ever to get the shot you want, and allows you to leave your shutter open for up to several hours, or as little as a few seconds. In long exposure mode you can either lock the shutter down manually and then release it, or set the exposure to a timer and just let it count down until it is finished. Pulse also supports HDR capabilities for differing lighting conditions!
Get epic star trails with Pulse's Long Exposure feature!
And don't worry! The light on Pulse blinks before it takes a photo so that it won't mess up the lighting of your shot, and you can always turn it off or dim it if needed. 
We've spent the last 4 years making the smartest time lapse products on the market. Pulse builds on all of our previous work, and makes time lapse easier than ever for first timers whilst expanding the features and level of control for experienced shooters. 
One of the biggest issues with traditional triggers is the inability to know when things have gone wrong. With Pulse's USB control your camera will get every single frame, and the app will let you know about problems (like low battery or buffering time) before they ruin your shoot.
Most remote triggers only let you do one thing - take photos. Because Pulse plugs into your camera's USB port and not the trigger port, it has the ability to let you control video as well. 
Pulse allows you to control up to three Pulse-equipped cameras at once - all from the same smartphone. This is especially useful for independent film makers or really anyone who has more cameras than they have camera hands. With Pulse, you can be everywhere at once and make sure you get all the right angles for your shot, even if you are just a crew of one. 
To add more than one Pulse to your order (up to 3), just add $74 to your pledge for each additional Pulse and your shipping cost will stay the same!
Pulse's Exposure Ramping features allows you to ramp your ISO and shutter speed so that you can capture day-to-night transitions (the "Holy Grail" of time lapses) without having to touch your camera. We've designed this feature specifically to work with LRTimelapse. 
Unlike shooting in Aperture or Shutter Priority, Exposure Ramping keeps your camera in manual so that your photo's EXIF-Data is written properly for LRTimelapse workflows.
When we first got started we were inspired to make better tools for motion time lapse. From that inspiration we built Radian, Michron, and Radian 2 - and brought them all to life through Kickstarter. This last year we got excited about remote camera control and the kinds of shots that remote control allows you to get.
Now we are back on Kickstarter to make Pulse. One of the big pieces of feedback that we got from our users and backers was that smartphone-enabled wireless camera control would not only make for better time lapses, but would open up a higher level of general photography to more people. We also wanted to make something that fit beautifully with your camera and felt like a natural extension of your camera's aesthetic and function. 
Thanks to our work with Radian 2 we had a huge head start on the electronics. And while there was some PCB trickery (or fun as Steve calls it) to get it all to fit into our enclosure, we are really happy with where it's all at. 
Initial drawing brainstorm on the Pulse mechanical design
A few of the early Pulse protos.
Why yes, there are 2 double sided PCBs in there - good eye!
Press Kit 
Full resolution photos and videos can be found in the Dropbox Link above and on Vimeo below. 
Full Resolution Video
We are a team of friends with a love for taking photos (especially time lapses!) and building things.  It all started in 2012 when Kris had the need for a motion time lapse device and was disappointed with what was available. Kris teamed up with his friends and roommates Kevin, Marcus and Steve to create the first Radian Kickstarter campaign. After delivering on Kickstarter and running out of Radian stock, the team put Radian sales on pause as some of the team moved to other jobs to keep up with bills as others finished up school.
In 2013, Steve teamed up with Greg to test the idea of a new stationary time lapse device and launched Michron on Kickstarter. They successfully delivered 4500 Michrons two weeks ahead of schedule in early 2014. With renewed momentum, we started a new manufacturing run of Radians, brought Greg and Michron onto the team, and started tinkering with some new product ideas. This last spring we launched Radian 2, the most advanced motion time lapse device on the market. Now we are back on Kickstarter to build Pulse and we cannot wait to see what you do with it.
This project is promoted by Jellop, a direct­ response online advertising agency specializing in Kickstarter campaigns on Facebook Ads and Google AdWords.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any physical product, there are a huge number of tasks and hurdles that need to be completed. However, we have a focused team that has run 3 successful Kickstarter campaigns already.

We take pride in being open with our backers and have a proven history of actually being transparent. We understand that regular communication is key, whether things are going great, or not so well. We also love this work, and we'll do our best to make this process educational and entertaining for you as well. So in addition to keeping you up to date on general progress, we will also strive to give you an in-depth look at the process of refining and delivering a real product. And if you are curious, we encourage you to check out updates from our previous campaigns!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi backers! 
In case you missed it, we recently launched the latest addition to the Alpine Labs product family - Spark! Our most versatile camera remote yet, Spark gives you multiple ways to trigger your camera, with or without your phone. Check out the campaign here. Also, we have some news regarding our project creator name here on Kickstarter!

updates.update_userinfo: One million photos taken with Pulse!
updates.update_content:
1,022,809 as of this afternoon to be exact! It’s been a few months since our last update and in that time we’ve been super focused on fine tuning the Pulse App and Firmware based on your feedback and making sure all of you have gotten Pulse. We do a lot of testing in house, but it just doesn’t compare to the sheer volume of use that backers put it through. Thank you for helping us make Pulse bullet proof!
It has been amazing seeing what you all have been up to. There are Pulse users in 86 different countries shooting long exposures, time lapses, portraits, and beautiful nature landscapes. Thank you again for supporting our idea to build Pulse and creating this community!

Hey there backers!
It’s been about a month since our last update. It is always a balancing act of getting things done and reaching milestones while simultaneously keeping you all updated! In short, we encountered several issues importing Pulse in large quantities. However, those issues are now resolved (more details below). Keep an eye out for a shipping email from us because 5,000 Pulses are shipping from our USA warehouse to you this week!

Hey there Backers!
It’s been a stressful and somewhat dramatic last couple weeks. We passed all Apple Certifications, solved some manufacturing challenges, and final assembly of Pulse began two days ago. We’ve already produced a few thousand units! A second test batch of 500 Pulses shipped from China yesterday and when they arrive (expected Thursday) we will begin shipping to backers.

Hey backers!
Greg here checking in. The mechanical housings are finished and the first test shipment of Pulses is on its way to our Boulder office! We'll be reviewing the quality of the Pulses over the weekend, jumping through some hoops with Apple early next week (see below), and should be making and shipping thousands of Pulses to the USA at the end of next week.
After we receive the large shipments and run some fulfillment tests we'll ship Pulses to all backers. This will take place over the next couple weeks, and you’ll get an update from us when shipping to backers has formally begun and no later than Sept 2nd.

Hey Everyone!
Greg here with an update. The full team is now back in the USA, we are continuing to refine Pulse, and there is strong anticipation to ship. Since the last update, the mechanical parts have been further delayed but everything else is cued up and ready to go. We currently expect to start shipping Pulses back to the USA in about two weeks.
In the meantime Pulse testing continues to go extremely well (see below for a quick demo!) and we’ve got an inspiring video from More Than Just Parks. Lastly, we will send out another update either when Pulse is shipping to you, or no later than Aug 12th.

Hey Backers!
Greg here with the update from China. Overall things are moving along quite well. Pulse testing with the roughly 100 Beta Backers has been extremely helpful. The app and firmware are proving quite robust and we are releasing more features for beta testing early next week. Manufacturing has had several small delays but through some creative problem solving and a lot of extra hours, we are still currently expecting to ship in July! To get the full report, please read below (or just check out the photos!).

Hey there backers!
It has been a big month and we have a LOT to tell you. At a high level Pulse is coming together beautifully (see photos below!), though not as quickly as we would like. We have started assembling Beta units this week, manufacturing is in process, and final delivery for all backers is now planned to start in early July (please fill out your survey!). We are extremely excited to show you what we’ve been up to so please read below for the full update.

Hey backers! 
Today we are sending out Kickstarter surveys to get your shipping and camera information. Please fill them out as soon as you can! If you expect your address to change before shipping, just type in your current address and you can update it later.
Important Notes:

Hey everyone!
Greg here with the update and we have got a lot to report! Pulse development and manufacturing are going slower than desired but are moving along, we’ll be sending out surveys in the next several days, and the Pulse Beta Build is underway as well. Overall electronics development has pushed back delivery about one month and we currently expect to ship in early June. See below for the full scoop! We’ve also got a stunning time lapse video of Zion National Park that we are excited to share with you.

campaign.story:
Hello! Thanks for checking out our Kickstarter campaign! With your help, we can bring the newest GoWorx® product to life. We did it last year with our best selling GoKnuckles, and we're excited to work with this community to do it again! Please enjoy, and help us share if you dig it.
We set out on a (product design) journey to change the way you mount and use your Smartphone to capture creatively. Today, we are ready to introduce you to FreeRide - a versatile and fully adjustable Smartphone Mount that enables you to simply and securely attach your Smartphone (with or without a case) to pretty much anything, anywhere! The FreeRide Smartphone Mount features both of the world's most popular camera mounting systems:
(1) You're free to directly connect your Smartphone to any mount or accessory designed for GoPro® HERO cameras, including existing GoWorx products!
(2) The included tripod adapter allows you to attach your Smartphone to any traditional camera mount (with universal ¼”-20 threads).

Pictured with: (Top) GoPro® Suction Cup, (Bottom-left) GoPro® Handlebar Mount + Pole Mount, (Bottom-right) GoPro® Handlebar / Seatpost / Pole Mount
FreeRide opens up a world of possibilities, whether you own a GoPro® HERO camera or not. We gave your Smartphone a secure connection to any mount that works with GoPro® HERO cameras. With thousands of different styles and purpose built mounts on the market, you've got creative control with your Smartphone. If you're already a GoPro enthusiast, now you've got another mountable camera to capture additional angles and take your film making to the next level! FreeRide also works great as a way to mount and control your phone when using the GoPro® App.
Pictured with: (Top) The Original Handle + GoPro® Handlebar / Seatpost / Pole Mount + GoPro® App, (Bottom-left) GoKnuckles, (Bottom-right) The Original Handle Pro + Aftermarket Lens System
FreeRide is 100% compatible with all the existing mounts designed by us here at GoWorx. When hooked up with our GoKnuckles, you'll have an ultra-portable and super functional "handsfree" grip for your Smartphone! Paired with The Original Handle and GoPro's Handlebar mount, FreeRide allows you to use your Smartphone as a display to view and control the GoPro® App - so you can adjust settings, and frame your shots perfectly.
Pictured with: Professional and consumer tripod styles
Leave your bulky DSLR camera at home. FreeRide lets you take the world's most popular camera (your Smartphone) and use it with traditional camera mounts and equipment like Tripods! Get ready to leverage your Smartphone's awesome camera features like Slow Motion and Time Lapse to their fullest extent.
This is our favorite part. We're finding exciting and unexpected applications for FreeRide every day! From simple solutions like mounting your Smartphone on your car dash - to the unexpected, like strapping your Smartphone to a 50mph RC car! We even sent our Smartphone to the skies on board a drone. We love the DIY (do-it-yourself) culture, which is why we love to design tools that empower you to be even more creative.
We designed FreeRide to ensure it'll stand up to your demands in any environment. The main body components are injection molded with a high-strength and impact resistant Polycarbonate. The hardware is precision machined from AISI 304 Stainless Steel and perfectly safe for use in fresh or salt water. The padding is a premium grade Urethane rubber with 100% recovery (will not deform) that securely and safely holds your Smartphone.
About GoKnuckles: Hit the streets, surf, and snow with the most awesome way to mount and use your GoPro® HERO camera and Smartphone! GoKnuckles are an incredibly functional and ultra-portable "handsfree" mount.
About The Original Handle: Leave your bulky camera gear at home and keep it simple with The Original Handle for your GoPro® HERO camera and Smartphone! Capture larger than life perspectives and stabilize your photos and videos with ease.
   Our Timeline:
Here's a snapshot of our timeline! Once we know we're well on our way to our funding goal, we can expedite our tooling phase, and hopefully get your FreeRide Smartphone Mounts shipped early! We've built in some extra time for fine tuning the first production samples so we can make sure we've refined every possible detail.
                               Can my Smartphone take a FreeRide?
FreeRide fits all Smartphones (with or without a case) between 56.5-86.5mm wide. Check out the full list of compatible devices below.
Compatible Devices:
Apple: iPhone 4/4S, iPhone 5/5S, iPhone 6, iPhone 6 Plus
Google: Nexus 5, Nexus 6
HTC: One (M7), One (M8), One (E8), One M9, One mini, One max, One remix
LG: G2, G3™, G4™, Risio™, Tribute 2™, Volt 2™, G Stylo™, Leon™, Escape 2™, Lancet™, Logos™, G Flex™, G Flex2, Transpyre™, Access™, Ultimate 2™, Tribute™, Realm™, G Vista™, Volt™, Optimus, Optimus Fuel™, D820, Enact™, Lucid2, Spirit, Mach, Venice, Escape, Spectrum 2, Splendor, Intuition, Motion, Elite, Viper, Lucid, Nitro
Motorola: Moto X, Moto G, Moto E, Droid Max, Droid Mini, Droid Turbo
Nokia: Lumia 435, Lumia 520, Lumia 521, Lumia 530, Lumia 535, Lumia 630, Lumia 635, Lumia 640, Lumia 640 XL, Lumia 735, Lumia 830, Luma 925, Lumia 928, Lumia 1020, Lumia 1320, Lumia 1520, Lumia Icon
Samsung: Galaxy S III, Galaxy S4, Galaxy S5, Galaxy S5 Mini, Galaxy S6, Galaxy Note 4,
Sony: Xperia™ M4, Xperia™ Z3
Don't see your Smartphone listed? Sorry we missed you! Please send us a message or leave a note in the comments and we'll be happy to help.
We asked hundreds of photographers, cinematographers, and action-adventure enthusiasts about the cameras, mounts, and accessories in their bag(s). Here’s what we learned:
The majority of GoPro® and DSLR camera users owned multiple camera mounts for different activities and shot requirements.
Everyone's using their Smartphone to capture photos and video.
Few had the tools necessary to securely attach their Smartphone to the mounts they already owned - but almost everyone wanted the ability to!
So, what if you could attach your Smartphone to pretty much anything, anywhere? Good question, right? We used our insights and questions as the basis of our design process. Realizing there's a camera mount designed for just about every purpose, we knew we had a compatibility issue. We quickly identified both of the world's most popular camera mounting systems - those designed for GoPro® HERO cameras, and those designed for traditional camera equipment like tripods. We researched, bought, and tested every product that had at least 1 similar function. What did we find? Too heavy, not secure enough, poorly designed, no versatility, etc. After 8 months, and 15 prototypes, we have developed a solution that meets the creative and performance demands of today's photographers, cinematographers, and action-adventure enthusiasts.
GoWorx is a team of designers, entrepreneurs, photographers, filmmakers, and action-adventure enthusiasts based in Asheville, North Carolina. We joined together to create performance and lifestyle products fused with innovation, simplicity, originality, and style. We design and manufacture mounts and accessories for GoPro HERO® cameras - and now Smartphones! Our products have been adopted by photo/video enthusiasts, action sports athletes, and adventurers throughout the world seeking to capture and share their experiences more creatively. If you share our passions for high-quality media content and extraordinary products – we invite you to join us.
Join our Community!
We're fortunate to have an incredible network of fans and brand ambassadors around the world creating epic media content. Check out a selection of our favorite photos above, and be sure to share your own photos and videos with us! We look forward to checking them out.
Have questions? We got you!
You can always reach us via email at contact@goworx.com or you can simply message us through Kickstarter.
Thank you!
No, seriously, thank you! To all our fans, friends, and family - we appreciate your support. Our team is looking forward to delivering an awesome product into your hands.
The End - So what? So Let's Dance!
Click here to download our Press Release and ALL our campaign images. We're excited about sharing FreeRide with the world! Please feel free to share our content and help us spread the word. Just be sure to include a link to our campaign/website. We even optimized our files for the web, so you don't have to! :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've spent the last 8 months developing, refining, and testing the design of the FreeRide Smartphone Mount to ensure we're launching a great product. Once we're well on our way towards our funding goal, we'll engage our manufacturer and material supplier(s) to begin tooling our molds and creating all of the various custom components involved.

That being said, product development is a complex process. Potential challenges could include slight tooling adjustments, delays in our supply chain, and/or international shipping. If challenges present themselves, we have a great team and network of resources to make sure this project flows as smoothly as possible!

We pledge to openly communicate with you through weekly project updates. When our campaign ends, we'll send out a survey to collect your shipping information, and color preferences where applicable.

---

International Customs Duties and Taxes:

The recipient may be charged all applicable duty, taxes, and/or brokerage fees C.O.D. in the local currency at the time of delivery. These are determined by your local government. Duties, taxes and/or Customs fees will be an additional amount that will be collected upon delivery of your order. All taxes, duties and customs fees are the responsibility of the customer.

---

GoWorx® is a registered trademark of Astro Worx Inc. GoWorx® is not affiliated with GoPro, Apple, Google, Samsung, Sony, Motorola, Nokia, LG, HTC, or any other manufacturer of cameras or Smartphones. GOPRO, HERO, and the GOPRO logo are trademarks or registered trademarks of GoPro, Inc. Android is a trademark of Google Inc. Apple is a trademark of Apple Inc., registered in the US and other countries.

updates.update_content:
Hello!
Kickstarter campaign complete, mission accomplished! We raised over 200% of our funding goal from the help of 354 backers from around the world. Thanks again! Here are a few important details:
Backer Surveys: We just sent out surveys to collect all of your shipping information and color preference (where applicable). Please be sure to complete and submit to us so there are no added delays with fulfillment.

Hey friends,
We're excited (and a bit sad) to say there's only a week left in our campaign. It's been a fun ride, and we definitely appreciate all your support. Currently, we're 166% funded through the help of 290+ backers from around the world! Pretty sweet.
For the past couple weeks, we've been working closely with our manufacturers to get the ball rolling, and we're just about ready to begin tooling our molds. We've already sampled and confirmed the custom hardware needed for FreeRide. Our team could not be more excited to get our hands on the first production parts!

Hey everyone,
Hope you all had a great weekend. We're super excited to share that FreeRide is over 110% funded here on Kickstarter with the help of 200 amazing backers! Luckily we have 19 more days to keep the momentum going.

Hey friends,
You guys are the best - we're already 80% funded and we just launched a week ago! We're excited to bring FreeRide into production. Right now we're focused on creating the custom hardware, finalizing tooling configurations, and developing the packaging. We are on track to begin production early!
Thanks to everyone who shared FreeRide with their friends. For anyone that would like to help us spread the word, we'd love to hit 100% with your help! Here's a quick link:

Hello, and happy Friday!
The team at GoWorx is excited to announce that FreeRide is already 45% funded (in less than 3 days)! Thanks to all of you for the initial support - we truly appreciate it. 
We're confident we'll get our campaign funded, so we're already taking the initial steps with our manufacturer(s) to bring FreeRide into production.

campaign.story:
Fits in with your keys, just like a WTF 2.0 ;)
Out of 10 projects, the main video is actually informative.  Please watch, it may answer any questions you have. :)
*UPDATE* Click to learn about TK-MQR
---
10 reasons to be a backer of THIS project
If you love Titanium and/or Functional Keychains, you will love this!
TUKK makes a perfect gift for anyone with keys
TUKK  balances Price, Strength, Design; did I mention Price?
TUKK was engineered to be the best Keychain I've ever made, and you will ever own.... well, until next time ;)
This project will be the most enjoyable project you have ever backed; I guarantee it. :)
 I love Kickstarter! I have backed 105 projects and will continue to support the ideas of others; Kickstarter is truly a great place.
I am a Kickstarter veteran and have 9 "over-funded" projects to my name; my supporters have received a superior product, early... every time.
 I will provide pictures and video on Instagram of the entire process. Come along for the ride; It's going to be EPIC :)
You will love the TUKK, I promise; there have been no dissatisfied backers in any of my projects.
The TUKK 100% USA Made, between Jess in Utah and me in Iowa! No slow boats from China.
---
Features
Just about half an ounce "weightless"
Imagine always having a sharp blade at hand
Follow me on Instagram
TUKK has Magnetic Retraction, and Retention
Slightly over 2" long, 1/2" wide, and 1/4" thick.
1/8" and 1 cm markings along the sides
Weighs in at just about 1/2 oz, or about 15grams
The blade is a #11 Hobby Blade. (not included)
Remove two T-6 Screws for blade change
The Main case is Grade 5 Titanium, while the button is Brass
***Designed for an exact blade type/brand only, I cannot guarantee any other blade. Click here to head to guaranteed blades on Amazon
---
My Story
My story has been about the same over the last 9 projects.  I'm just a guy in my garage, making things better one project at a time.  Kickstarter gives the ability for a "normal guy" to do what he loves. (I suggest YOU do a project, I'll help you) I have set out to make things that you can ACTUALLY use. 
It's true I don't have a fancy page, pay for photography, or video.  You are getting 100% me in these projects.  Many people have said my projects are very unique in that my heart is in these projects, it's not a money show for me.
There have been a crazy amount of "keychains" since I first launched my Bottle Grenade; that aren't actually usable/functional.  Kind of upsetting really, but no worries you are here now. So lets make this story together, as the project goes on :)
---
Since pictures don't really do the TUKK justice, I opted to make this project more about the video. So please watch this video if you are interested in seeing more about it and how to use it.
---
My Goal (Thanks Jess Proctor)
My goal is $1000, that is for purchasing the Titanium in bulk. $50 is "cheap" for a Titanium Utility Knife. There have been a few larger versions (including my own TK-RZR) but nobody had really tackled the small and actually carriable (that's a word... right?) utility knife.  The hobby blade idea comes from Jess Proctor of the "Gear-a-biner"  so Jess is a part of this project, and he will be making the Brass button for the TUKK.  I'll make the Titanium cases, and if I happen to get behind, I'm sure he will pick up some of the slack, haha - Thanks Jess!
---
Because the TUKK uses magnets, it's magnetic enough to hold itself on metal objects, perfect to keep it handy.
Slightly Magnetic! Can keep it handy on your tool box
---
Stretchgoals?
Of course, lets talk in comments :)  - Anodizing, Different Metals, A quick detach system, or... What do YOU want? Lets talk!
Click for Instagram Post
Click to see the Anodizing picture
I've been playing around a little, here is an "idea" for a clip (clip from my TK-Vector)
Click for Instagram
---
Do you have a TiKeY? Well....
Leaves room for a few keys on the other side (in a TiKeY)
---
Short Disclaimer
(More Disclaimer at bottom of page)
Now, this is all cool right?  There has to be a Disclaimer and some rules set.  This may turn you off from pledging, but it's gotta be said.
Do not store in your pocket, as it may open automatically and damage you or your clothing.
You are responsible for the laws where you live.
You must be at least 18 years of age.
TUKK is shipped without a blade.  What you do with TUKK after receiving it is on you, I assumes no liability associated with product usage.
Here is an example of "not storing in your pocket"
Click to learn more
---
Prototype VS Production
Feel free to ask questions in the comments :)
Prototype:
Some holes were tweaked with a hand drill, it was hand tapped, hand chamfered, Didn't have correct endmills, etc - Takes up to 30+ min to make one, and they aren't as accurate as they could be. The parts were not tumbled to perfection. Many little details you may never notice, I notice :)
Production:
All parts will be made on a CNC mill, which means tolerances around .001" (1 thousandths of an inch) - if it's it's not perfect, it goes in the recycle bin. All parts will be tumbled in a special media for up to 24 hours to be sure it's as smooth as a baby's... well.. you get the idea :)
So as you can see the Prototype is just that. I try very hard to make my Prototypes look like the Production units. However, the end result is always better :)
--- Thank you for your support!
I love this place :)
Brad & Family
---
If you are on Instagram, be sure to check out my page.  You never know what you will find. Click below.
Click for Instagram
---
Note: This project will only run for 21 days
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges

Like anything, there could be bumps in the road. Since this is my 10th project, I have 9 successful and "over-funded" Kickstarter projects, I do not foresee any issues that would result in shipping late.

I will be doing 100% of the work in my own shop. Nothing in this project is new to me. Almost all of my projects have been made with Titanium, Brass, Copper, Aluminum, Polished and/or anodized; plus, it's all been shipped to over 6,000 backers! You could say "I'm the man for the job". 

You can count on me to get your reward out by the due date; I believe in the "under promise, over deliver" philosophy. Check out any of my previous Kickstarter projects, to get a clear picture of my history. You will not be disappointed.

You will get Pictures and Video of all steps in "Updates".

TK-TUKK Steps:

Online: Order the Brass, and Titanium

CNC Mill: Turn raw stock into TK-TUKK parts

The rest of this is done by hand and a little "elbow grease".
- Inspect and then Debur the parts in a tumbler
- Clean the Parts
- Inspect the Parts
- Anodize???
- Inspect the parts again! :)
- Assemble the TK-TUKK
- Clean the parts again!
- Package the completed TK-TUKK

Shipping:

- Print Labels and Ship the Rewards to their new homes... YOUR HOME!

There is a lot done by hand; just because there is some CNC work, doesn't mean it's not a lot of hands on work.

Thank you for the support!
---
